https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Structural Steel Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3313
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4300). Design of steel structures and bridges. Topics include composite beams, plate girder design, and moment resistant connections.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Structural Design and Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 4300
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 7310). Design and analysis of building frames and bridges in steel and concrete using case studies. Economic selection of structural type and material. Basic methods of analysis for statically indeterminate structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Structural System Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3312 and CV_ENG 3313
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4330). Design of buildings in steel and reinforced concrete, including estimation of loads and design of gravity and lateral force resisting systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Matrix Methods of Structural Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3300
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4350). An introduction to the fundamentals of stiffness and flexibility methods for analysis of truss and frame structures. Application of the STRUDL and NASTRAN programs to three dimensional structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Bridge Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3312 and CV_ENG 3313
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4360). Review of Highway Bridge Analysis and Design Fundamentals. Study of Influence Line Diagrams and sheer and Moment Envelopes.  Design of medium-and Sort-Span Girder Bridges based on AASHTO LRFD Specs.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Design of Structures for Blast and Fire
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4365). General overview of Blast Design; risk assessment and design criteria; simplifies Blast Effects Analysis; ground shock, material response; anti-terrorism design considerations; weapons effects and mitigation; internal explosions; progressive collapse analysis; and introduction to Fire Design. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Geotechnical Earthquake Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3400 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4404). This course will provide an introduction to topics relating to geotechnical aspects of earthquake engineering.  Topics to be covered include; basic seismology, seismic hazard analysis, dynamic soil properties, site response analysis and soil properties, site response analysis and soil liquefaction. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Foundation Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3400
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4410). Subsurface exploration. Design of basic foundation structures: shallow foundations, retaining walls, deep foundations.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Geotechnical Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade or C- or better in CV_ENG 3400
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4412). Study of concepts, theories, and design procedures for modern earthwork engineering including: compaction and densification of soils and soil improvement, seepage and drainage, slope stability and performance, and earth retaining structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Construction Methods and Equipment
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 1300 or MATH 1500, or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Selection and use of construction equipment, planning construction operations, equipment economics and operations analyses.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Mechanics of Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 7600; cross-leveled with MAE 4600, CV_ENG 4600).  Advanced concepts, methodology and solution procedures in mechanics of materials, including the theories of stress and strain in three-dimensions, linear stress-strain-temperature relations, inelastic material behavior and energy methods, as well as selected topics such as torsion, nonsymmetrical bending and shear center for thin-wall beam cross sections.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Sensors and Experimental Stress Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in ENGINR 2200 and PHYSCS 2760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4610). Sensors and instrumentation for stress analysis, mechanical measurement and health monitoring of civil structures.  Application and design of data acquisition systems, digital signals and basic digital signal processing.  Electronics and instrumentation circuits.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Vibration Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MATH 4100 and MAE 2600
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 7660; cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4660, MAE 4660). Vibration theory with application to mechanical systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to the Finite Element Method
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: ENGINR 2200, and CV_ENG 3300 or MAE 3100Recommended: CV_ENG 4006/CV_ENG 7006, CV_ENG 4350/CV_ENG 7350
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 7280; cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4680, MAE 4280). This course covers a variety of topics related to the finite element method when applied to the analysis of solid, structural, fluid, and heat transfer problems. Specifically, we will apply the finite element method to solve a variety of problems including trusses, beams, frames, thermal analysis, and fluid mechanics. Students are required to use FEA software for computer assignments.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Structural Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3300
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4692). Theory of structural response to dynamics loads.  Computation of dynamic response of structures to dynamic loads like blast and earthquake. Modal analysis and single degree of freedom methods will be covered.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Hydraulics of Open Channels
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: graduate standing and Grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3700
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4700). Gradually varied flow and theory of the hydraulic jump. Slowly varied flow involving storage; rating curves.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Pipeline Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Theoretical and practical aspects of pipeline engineering including pipeline transport of natural gas and various solids such as coal, sand and solid wastes.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Hydrology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in CV_ENG 3700 and CV_ENG 3702, or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4703). Modern methods of applied hydrologic analysis and synthesis of hydrologic records.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Soil and Water Conservation Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: BIOL_EN 2180 or CV_ENG 3200 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7150; cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4710, BIOL_EN 4150). Urban and rural run-off and erosion analysis.  Design and layout of erosion control structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Watershed Modeling Using GIS
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: BIOL_EN 2180 or CV_ENG 3200 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7350). Watershed evaluation using AVSWAT for hydrology, sediment yield, water quality; includes USLE, MUSLE, WEPP. Procedures for model calibration/sensitivity data analysis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Hydraulic Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4730). Design of hydraulic infrastructure utilizing principles of both pressure conduits and open channels. Hand calculations and use of commercial design software for water distribution (quantity and quality), stormwater collection and sanitary sewer systems, and detention basins. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Irrigation and Drainage Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7250; cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4740). Soil, water, plant relationships. Water supplies and design of surface, sprinkler and drip irrigation systems. Surface and tile drainage.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Analysis of Water-Resource Systems
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with CV_ENG 4792). Applies hydrology, hydraulic and sanitary engineering, and economics to water-resource design problems considering man and his environment. Uses methods of systems analysis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Transportation Planning and Models
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Regional and metropolitan transportation studies; land use, traffic generation, distribution and assignment models.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Asphalt Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced topics in the formulation, analysis, and design of asphalt materials, flexible, and composite pavement systems. Fundamental topics including theories and techniques for accurate viscosity measurement, the phenomenological theory of linear viscoelasticity, non-linear and stress-dependent time- and temperature-dependent response, fracture mechanics of quasi-brittle materials, visco-eleasto-plasticity, micromechanics, and finite/discrete element modeling principles and applications. Application of fundamental topics in modern asphalt material and pavement design including AASHTOWare Pavement M-E. Pavement sustainability. A comprehensive term project is required, which can be centered around a literature review, laboratory study, and/or modeling study to be mutually agreed upon by the student and instructor. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Theory of Traffic Flow
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Scientific approach to study of traffic phenomena with emphasis on applications. Deterministic and stochastic models of traffic flow; optimization of intersection controls; computer simulation of traffic problems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Highway Transportation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Economics of transportation on highways. Comparison of vehicle operation costs. Project studies of highway problems in general.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Research Methods in Transportation Engineering
Water Quality Modeling
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Derivation and application of models for describing oxygen budget, nutrient exchange, and biological productivity in streams, lakes and estuaries.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Hazardous Waste Treatment Processes
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Course includes some introductory materials about hazardous waste regulations followed by advanced treatment methods such as air stripping, soil-vapor extraction, chemical oxidation, membrane processes, in-situ and ex-situ biotreatment methods, solidification and thermal processes.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Environmental Biotechnology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Major biochemical reactions relevant to environmental engineering.  Theory and application of fundamental principles of attached and suspended microbial growth and process engineering for sanitary engineering and biodegradation.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Design of Water and Wastewater Treatment Facilities
Environmental Regulatory Policy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Discussion of the various policy aspects of environmental regulation: economic and non-economic impacts of degradation; risk assessment and management; distribution of environmental risks; regulatory tools; federal vs. state; disclosure; enforcement. Relation to environmental laws. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Behavior of Reinforced Concrete Members
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The design philosophy, constitutive laws, creep rate sensitivity and aging, shrinkage. Nonlinear response of reinforced concrete members. Deflection computation and control. Bond and anchorage.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nondestructive Evaluation Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will present the interaction of nondestructive evaluation (NDE) technologies and engineering decision-making.  Theory and application NDE technologies will be presented in the context of the engineering analysis required to effectively utilize the technologies.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Random Vibration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Analysis of random vibrations including topics in stationary, ergodic and nonstationary random processes, with application to single-degree of freedom, discrete and continuous mechanical systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Continuum Mechanics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 8320). Introductory course in the mechanics of continuous media. Basic concepts of stress, strain, constitutive relationships; conservation laws are treated using Cartesian tensor notation. Examples from both solid and fluid mechanics investigated.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Space Mechanics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Rigid body dynamics analysis of satellites, space vehicles. Trajectories, time of flight optimization.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Theory of Plasticity
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 8360). Plastic yield conditions and stress-strain relations. Behavior of elastic-perfectly plastic members. Plain strain in plastic members.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Reinforced Concrete Theory and Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced design of reinforced concrete structures; review of standard codes and specifications and their influence.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nonlinear Mechanical Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Analysis of behavior of nonlinear mechanical systems. Nonlinear phenomena of importance in mechanical design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Topics Structural Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Computer implementation and application of finite element analysis. Material and geometric nonlinearities. Plastic analysis of structures. Code provisions for analysis of seismic and wind loadings.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Dynamics of Structures
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 8392). Study of the dynamic behavior of structures. Analysis of equivalent lumped parameter systems for the design of structures in a dynamic environment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Consolidation and Settlement
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Settlement of soil, Theory of Consolidation, consolidation testing, settlements of earth fills and embankments, stress distribution in soils, elastic settlement, bearing capacity of shallow foundations, shallow foundations design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Seepage in Soils
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: General principles that govern flow of water through soils and specific procedures for analysis and design of filtration and drainage media in geotechnical and geoenvironmental applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Soil Behavior
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Detailed study of composition, fabric, and geotechnical and hydrologic properties of soils that consist partly or wholly of clay.  Emphasizes physico-chemical factors governing volume change and shear strength.  Expansive clay behavior is examined in detail.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Soil Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Cover topics relating to the response of soils to dynamic loading.  Topics to be covered include: lab and field methods, cyclic soil models, foundation vibrations, and wave propagation through soil.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Foundation Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Foundation design beyond simple spread footings, special footings and beams on an elastic foundations, mat foundations, pile foundations - static capacity, lateral loads, bucklin, dynamic analysis load tests, pile groups, drilled piers.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Stability and Performance of Earth Slopes
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles, mechanics and procedures for analyzing the stability of earth slopes and landfills under short-term, long-term, rapid drawdown, and earthquake conditions.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Design and Analysis of Earth Retaining Structures
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: General principals and specific procedures for analysis and design of earth retention systems including consideration of soil-structure interaction.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Materials and Measurement
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: About 25% of the course is devoted to the physical measurement of strain, force, displacement and motion. Remainder of course is devoted to advanced study of the behavior of steel and concrete with emphasis on brittle fracture in steel.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 8620). Fundamental principles of advanced rigid body dynamics with applications. Special mathematical techniques including Lagrangian and Hamiltonian methods.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Vibrations of Distributed Parameter Systems
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MAE 8630). Vibration analysis of strings, cables, bars, rods, shafts, beams, membranes, plates, circular rings, frames; free and forced oscillation; miscellaneous loading; various boundary conditions; effect of damping; energy methods; method of difference equations.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Environmental Hydraulics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Fundamental and applied fluid dynamics in various environmental hydraulics systems. Topics include mechanics of gravity waves, layers in stratified fluids, turbulence and modeling, jet and plumes, mixing and transport in rivers, lakes, and estuaries. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research-Masters Thesis in Civil & Environmental Engineering
Medical Terminology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Medical terminology based on a word building system. This course is intended for students majoring in health professions, nursing and other helping professions, pre-med and biology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Medical Terminology - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Medical terminology based on a word building system. This course is intended for students majoring in health professions, nursing and other helping professions, pre-med and biology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Diagnostic Applications I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Acceptance into Radiologic Sciences, Radiography Program
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as RA_SCI 3460). Interdisciplinary small group, case-based study of common cardiovascular, pulmonary and other diseases.  Pathophysiology, diagnosis and treatment from the perspective of allied health professionals.  Emphasis on critical thinking, teamwork skills.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Diagnostic Applications I - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Acceptance into Radiologic Sciences, Radiography Program
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as RA_SCI 3460W). Interdisciplinary small group, case-based study of common cardiovascular, pulmonary and other diseases.  Pathophysiology, diagnosis and treatment from the perspective of allied health professionals.  Emphasis on critical thinking, teamwork skills.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Problems in Clinical and Diagnostic Sciences
Radiation Safety and Biology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Junior standingRecommended: One course in Biological Sciences and Physics/Chemistry
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Regulations and procedures for safe uses of radiation to heighten student understanding of radiation physics, radiation biology, and radiation safety. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cardiovascular and Pulmonary Diagnostic Applications II
Emergency and Disaster Management in Healthcare
Asthma Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will provide the student with a multi-faceted approach to caring for the patient with asthma. Topics include pathophysiology, pharmacology, patient/family education, patient assessment and management. Assists students to take the Asthma Educator Credentialing Exam. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Healthcare Organization and Leadership
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: In this course, students will explore leadership principles as they relate to the student's focus area, combining previous expertise in the field with an interdisciplinary perspective within the healthcare community.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Healthcare Organization and Leadership - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: In this course, students will explore leadership principles as they relate to the student's focus area, combining previous expertise in the field with an interdisciplinary perspective within the healthcare community.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Emergency and Disaster Management in Healthcare
Asthma Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will provide the student with a multi-faceted approach to caring for the patient with asthma. Topics include pathophysiology, pharmacology, patient/family education, patient assessment and management. Assists students to take the Asthma Educator Credentialing Exam.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Clinical and Diagnostic Sciences
Research in Clinical and Diagnostic Sciences
Problems in Clinical and Diagnostic Sciences
Research in Clinical and Diagnostic Sciences
Product and Customer Support in Health Care Industry
Sales and Marketing in Health Care Industry
Applied Research Methodologies in Clinical and Diagnostic Sciences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: BHS degree in CDS and or allied health professions, and Program and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Practical research application of clinical and diagnostic sciences (CDS) in a real time clinical environment: exploring the various methods of applied clinical research and how they relate to decision making, patient handling, technical applications, instrumentation and image processing. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The Clinical Capstone is the culminating academic endeavor of students who earn the MHSCDS degree. The project provides an opportunity to explore a problem or issue of particular personal or professional interest and to address that problem or issue through focused study and applied research under the direction of a faculty member(s) and professional mentors. The project should demonstrate the student's ability to synthesize and apply the knowledge and skills acquired in his/her academic program to real-world issues and problems. This final project should affirm students' ability to think critically and creatively, to solve practical problems, to make reasoned and ethical decisions, and to communicate effectively. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Laboratory Operations
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Clinical Laboratory Students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course provides a basic introduction to the theory, practical application, technical performance and evaluation of laboratory skills specific to the practice of clinical laboratory science. Laboratory safety; microscopy; pipetting; general laboratory equipment; quality control; mathematics; phlebotomy; pre-analytic, analytic and post-analytic processes, including specimen collection, processing and transport to maintain test result integrity, will be addressed. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Clinical Hematology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Clinical Laboratory Students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course introduces the theory, practical application, technical performance and evaluation of hematological and hemostasis procedures. Correlation of laboratory data with the diagnosis of erythrocyte, leukocyte and bleeding/clotting disorders will be introduced. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Clinical Microbiology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Clinical Laboratory Students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course introduces the theory, practical application, technical performance and evaluation of procedures for isolation, identification and susceptibility testing of infectious disease organisms in humans. The course primarily focuses on bacteriology, but will include introductory coverage of parasitology, mycology and virology. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis
Clinical Laboratory Science Theory, Application and Correlation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: departmental consent, accepted in into the Medical Technology Program
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Application, evaluation and correlation of laboratory procedures used in the diagnosis and treatment of common disease states.  Opportunities for building critical thinking, problem solving, and leadership skills are provided in small group clinical case discussions. Course may be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course expands on the theory, practical application, and evaluation of basic laboratory procedures introduced in CL_L_S 4407 Clinical Laboratory Operations and CL_L_S 4410 Introduction to Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis, with an emphasis on common automated methodologies used in clinical chemistry and urinalysis laboratories. This course will focus on the interpretation, evaluation and correlation of clinical laboratory data with the diagnosis and treatment monitoring of carbohydrate, renal, hepatic, protein, cardiac, lipid/lipoprotein, major and minor electrolyte, enzyme, pancreatic-gastrointestinal and acid-base disorders.  May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course expands on the theory, practical application, and evaluation of laboratory procedures introduced in CL_L_S 4414 Clinical Chemistry and Urinalysis I and CL_L_S 4444 Clinical Core Laboratory Practical I. Correlation of clinical laboratory data with the diagnosis and treatment monitoring of carbohydrate, renal, hepatic, cardiac, lipid/lipoprotein, protein, major and minor electrolyte, trace element, enzyme, pancreatic-gastrointestinal and acid-base disorders; tumor markers; and inborn errors of metabolism is emphasized.   Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Hematology I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: departmental consent, accepted into the Medical Technology Program
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to the theory, practical application, technical performance and evaluation of hematological and coagulation procedures.  Emphasis on correlations of clinical laboratory data with the diagnosis and treatment of anemia, leukemia, and bleeding/clotting disorders.   May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Hematology II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course expands on the theory, practical application, and evaluation of hematological and hemostasis procedures introduced in CL_L_S 4416 Clinical Hematology I and CL_L_S 4444 Clinical Core Laboratory Practicum I, and includes the analysis of cerebrospinal, synovial and serous fluids.  Correlation of clinical laboratory data with the diagnosis and treatment of erythrocyte, leukocyte and bleeding/clotting disorders will be emphasized.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Microbiology I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course includes the theory, practical application, and evaluation of immunological components and infection disease serology. The principles and methodologies used in the assessment of immunologically related disorders, including hypersensitivity reactions, autoimmune, Immunoproliferative, immunodeficient disorders and infectious disease are included. The course emphasizes the correlation of clinical laboratory data with the patient's diagnosis and treatment. The theory and application of molecular diagnostic tools, such as polymerase chain reaction (PCR), nucleic acid probes, and microarrays are also addressed.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Microbiology II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course builds on the theory, practical application and evaluation of the procedures for isolation, identification and susceptibility testing of infectious disease organisms in humans introduced in CL_L_S 4418 Clinical Microbiology I and CL_L_S 4448 Clinical Microbiology Laboratory Practicum I. This course includes bacteriology, mycology, parasitology, and virology content, and will emphasize the correlation of clinical laboratory data with the patient's diagnosis and treatment.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Immunology and Molecular Diagnostics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course includes the theory, practical application, and evaluation of immunological components and infection disease serology. The principles and methodologies used in the assessment of immunologically related disorders, including hypersensitivity reactions, autoimmune, Immunoproliferative, immunodeficient disorders and infectious disease are included. The course emphasizes the correlation of clinical laboratory data with the patient's diagnosis and treatment. The theory and application of molecular diagnostic tools, such as polymerase chain reaction (PCR), nucleic acid probes, and microarrays are also addressed.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Immunohematology I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: departmental approval, accepted into the Medical Terminology Program
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to the theory, practical application, technical performance and evaluation of blood bank procedures required for transfusion of blood and blood components and for handling and storage of blood and blood components. May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A/F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Immunohematology II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course expands on the theory, practical application, and evaluation of immunohematology procedures presented in CL_L_S 4422 Clinical Immunohematology I and CL_L_S 4442 Clinical Immunohematology Laboratory Practicum I. There is an emphasis on the application of immunohematology procedures used for the resolution of complex immunohematology problems. Proper selection of immunohematology procedures that assist in the diagnosis and management of hemolytic conditions will be discussed. Concepts in patient blood management and the adverse effects of transfusion will be presented. Quality management as it applies to transfusion medicine will be addressed.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Laboratory Management I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Clinical Lab Sci (Medical Technology) Program students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course introduces the theory, practical application and evaluation of laboratory management principles in healthcare, including safety, research, educational methodology, quality control, ethics, laboratory operations, point-of-care testing, scope of practice, and the job application process. Opportunities for building critical thinking, problem-solving, research, communication, professionalism, management and leadership skills are provided.   Graded on A-F basis only.  May be repeated for credit.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Lab Management II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of Clinical Lab Management I. Theory, practical application, and evaluation of laboratory management principles and associated models in compliance and regulatory issues, human resource management, method evaluation, professionalism and laboratory quality.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Lab Management II - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of Clinical Lab Management I. Theory, practical application, and evaluation of laboratory management principles and associated models in compliance and regulatory issues, human resource management, method evaluation, professionalism and laboratory quality.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Current Trends in Clinical Laboratory Sciences
Public Speaking - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles, process of speech communication in small group and public speaking situations.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Digital Media Production
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as DST_VS 1880, FILMS_VS 1880, ENGLSH 1880, ARTGE_VS 1920). Introduction to concepts and skills for Digital Storytelling, including media literacy and forms of narrative manifested historically and currently across a range of media. This course focuses on theories and concepts that support the critical analysis and creation of contemporary narrative in digital form with particular attention to audio, visual and written communication. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Media Communication in Society - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: An introduction to the development and impact of media communications and its technologies on American society. Emphasis on contemporary industry developments, their historical antecedents, as well as contemporary issues related to the influence and impact of media communication on society.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Video Workshop: Sports Broadcast Production
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A hands-on workshop; students will learn live sports video production theory and techniques from Mizzou Athletics broadcast professionals. Students will participate in all phases of video production (camera operations, directing, graphics, video replay, and live audio production and digital editing) in a variety of live sports projects. The class will help produce games for SEC Network Plus. There is no requirement of previous production experience or course work.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Basic Audio Production and Performance
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Radio speaking in varied types of programs; console operations, tape editing, microphone techniques.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Screenwriting I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as FILMS_VS 2530). Analyze various script formats and apply different writing techniques and styles to create screenplays and teleplays. Work inside a creative critique environment to craft vivid storytelling and character elements while developing viable loglines and pitches for their stories. Screenwriting concepts include the three-act structure and the timing and placement of plot points. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Screenwriting I - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as FILMS_VS 2530). Analyze various script formats and apply different writing techniques and styles to create screenplays and teleplays. Work inside a creative critique environment to craft vivid storytelling and character elements while developing viable loglines and pitches for their stories. Screenwriting concepts include the three-act structure and the timing and placement of plot points. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Marginalization and the Media - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Communication 2648 Honors presents an overview of how social identities of marginalized groups are constructed within the broader media landscape. In particular it focuses on how the media, in various manners, represents marginalized groups in society. Further, it gives an effective overview of the effects of stereotypical imagery on viewers. However it also provides an introduction to the prosocial representations and effects across a variety of media. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication - General
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics in Communication - General.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication - General - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration; Honors eligibility required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics in Communication - General.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication - Behavioral Science
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics in Communication - Behavioral Science.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication - Behavioral Science - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics in Communication - Behavioral Science.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication - Humanities/Fine Arts
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics in Communication - Humanities/Fine Arts.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Story Development
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as DST_VS 2810).  In this course students will learn about storytelling across time and media, beginning with definitions and fundamentals of narrative and oral storytelling, theories of narrative and its cultural functions, and basic narrative analysis. The course then turns to the close study of structure, narration, character, plot, action, dialogue, and other narrative elements, with a wide variety of examples and prompts. Throughout the course, students practice the development of their own stories in multiple versions and formats, with attention to the ways that formal structures such as blogs, tweets, podcasts, and scripts affect their storytelling strategies. By the end of the course, students will produce a short shooting script or equivalent project ready for production. Thus, the course functions as preparation for audio-visual production courses in Communication, Film Studies, Media Studies, Film and Media Arts, and Digital Storytelling degree programs. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Digital Storytelling Production I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as ENGLSH 2880, DST_VS 2880). Digital Storytelling Production I teaches agility with digital video technology through applied experiences. Assignments in digital video production emphasize how video narratives are created and how images and audio enhance the structure, mood, and theme of the narrative. Instruction will focus on planning a video production and developing the tools and practices in lighting, sound recording, image capturing, and editing. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Message Design and Writing for the Media
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 2100.   May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course introduces students to writing for the media in various contexts including television, film and new media (e.g., websites and social media).

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Digital Production I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focus on building familiarity with video cameras, microphones, lighting, editing as well as the fundamentals of visual composition, (framing, camera angles, story boards, and  ways to visualize information) and processes and procedures for producing and directing.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Digital Production II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 3390 or instructor's consent.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focus on advanced production work; more elaborate projects including digital shorts, music videos, and short documentaries; advanced editing, storyboards, and emphasis on developing narrative structure.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Communication Research Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing and COMMUN 1200.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focuses on writing and administering surveys, conducting field research, and designing experimental studies.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Communication Research Methods - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing and COMMUN 1200; Honors eligibility required.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focuses on writing and administering surveys, conducting field research, and designing experimental studies.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nonverbal Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing and COMMUN 1200.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Analysis of form and content of nonverbal communication. Emphasis on role of nonverbal cues in interpersonal communication.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Organizational Advocacy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Theory and analysis of communication to promote organizational culture and image.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Culture as Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as ANTHRO 3470, LINGST 3470). Study of the influence of culture on communication processes. Examines topics such as the impact of values, languages, and nonverbal behavior on intercultural interaction.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Media Effects
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 2100 or senior standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of the topics, research, and theories in the study of media effects.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Conflict and Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing required.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Theory and analysis of communication in conflict situations across a variety of contexts.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Relational Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing and COMMUN 1200.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Analysis of communication influences on relational identities and development.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Performance of Literature
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as ENGLSH 3570 and THEATR 3200). Analysis and oral interpretation of literary works. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Group Decision Making Processes
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as PEA_ST 3521). Procedures and techniques for interpersonal communication and decision making in small groups.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Argument and Advocacy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 1200.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Critical analysis and production of argument emphasizing evidence, reasoning, and refutation.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Argument and Advocacy - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 1200; Honors eligibility required.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Critical analysis and production of argument emphasizing evidence, reasoning, and refutation.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Business and Professional Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles and practice of speech communication in business and professional settings. Emphasis on interviews, group conferences and personal presentations.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Business and Professional Communication - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles and practice of speech communication in business and professional settings. Emphasis on interviews, group conferences and personal presentations.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Crisis Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The theory and practice of corporate and political communication responses to crisis situations.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication-General
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 1200 and COMMUN 2100.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Organized study of selected topics. Subjects and earnable credit may vary from semester to semester. Departmental consent required for repetition.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Communication - General - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: may be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics in Communication - General.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Professional Seminar in Television Production
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: COMMUN 3390 and instructor's consent.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Application of principles to advanced television production, direction.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Gender, Language, and Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: junior standing or departmental consent.  May be restricted to Communication majors only during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as LINGST 4412, ANTHRO 4412; cross-leveled with COMMUN 7412, LINGST 7412, ANTHRO 7412). Relationship among gender, language, nonverbal communication, and culture.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Communicating Research and Scholarship
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Junior or Senior Standing. Permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Course is for undergraduate researchers, scholars, and artists to enhance communicating their research and scholarship to a variety of audiences and in multiple modes of communication. Students will use their own research, scholarly interests, and creative projects to create several communication pieces that may include abstracts/artist statements, press releases, elevator talks, manuscripts, presentations, posters, and short videos. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Junior or Senior Standing; honors eligibility required. Permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Course is for undergraduate researchers, scholars, and artists to enhance communicating their research and scholarship to a variety of audiences and in multiple modes of communication. Students will use their own research, scholarly interests, and creative projects to create several communication pieces that may include abstracts/artist statements, press releases, elevator talks, manuscripts, presentations, posters, and short videos. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Junior or Senior Standing; honors eligibility required. Permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Course is for undergraduate researchers, scholars, and artists to enhance communicating their research and scholarship to a variety of audiences and in multiple modes of communication. Students will use their own research, scholarly interests, and creative projects to create several communication pieces that may include abstracts/artist statements, press releases, elevator talks, manuscripts, presentations, posters, and short videos. Graded on A-F basis only.
