https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Analytic continuation, Riemann surfaces, entire and meromorphic functions, selected topics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Differentiable Manifolds
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 7920 or equivalent; MATH 7900 or equivalent; MATH 8655 or equivalent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course is about calculus in very general settings, which may include curved spaces and abstractly defined spaces. Its origins go back to attempts to make maps of the Earth taking into account its curvature; its modern applications include mechanics, dynamical systems, partial differential equations, and most famously Einstein's theory of gravity.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Ordinary Differential Equations I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics from existence and uniqueness theorems, plane autonomous systems, periodicity and boundedness of solutions of second order nonlinear equations, perturbation theory, Sturm-Liouville systems, behavior of solutions at singularities.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Partial Differential Equations I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 4700 or MATH 7700 or instructor's consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Fourier and integral transforms, first and second order partial differential equations, methods of characteristics, Laplace's equation, Direchlet and Neumann problems, Green's functions and maximum principles.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Partial Differential Equations II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The Cauchy-Kovalevski theorem, the Lewy example, the heat operator, the wave operator, Sobolev spaces, local regularity of elliptic boundary value problems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Mathematical Finance I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: graduate standing in Mathematics.  Knowledge of elementary probability or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as FINANC 8340). Financial instruments and derivative: stocks, bonds, futures option prices on interest rates, swaps, etc.  Mathematical models of stock price fluctuations.  Interest rates and options on interest rates.  Swaps.  Open markets and properties of stock option prices.  Stochastic models. Bionomial trees.  Continuous time stochastic modeling.  No arbitrage modeling.  European and American options.  BlackScholes model and differential equation, for the price of European option.  Exotic options.  Interest rate models.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Mathematical Finance II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: knowledge of advance probability/stochastic processes or instructor's consentRecommended: MATH 8460
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Diffusion Processes as models for stock price fluctuations. Contingent claims and arbitrage.  Mathematical analysis of risk neutral valuation of contingent claims.  Self-financing portfolios and hedging.  Hedging contingent claims.  Partial differential equations for valuation of derivative securities. Completeness of the markets and hedging.  Parity relations and delta hedging.  Several underlying assets.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Probability
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 4320 or MATH 8220; or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as STAT 9810). Measure theoretic probability theory. Characteristic functions; conditional probability and expectation; sums of independent random variables including strong law of large numbers and central limit problem.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics of Geometry
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics of Geometry.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Commutative Algebra I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course deals with fundamentals and basic techniques of Commutative Algebra. This can be a good introduction to Algebraic Geometry and Algebraic Number theory. The course begins with Rings, Ideals, Modules, Localization. Homological Algebra with concepts leading to Flatness, Dimension, Depth, Ascending and Descending Chain Conditions and Completion would be some of the typical material covered in this course, although other topics may be introduced as well. Topics such as Cohen-Macaulay Rings, Normal Rings, Regular Rings, Gorenstein Rings, Noether Normalization, Primary Decomposition, etc. may be covered if time permits or will be continued in the second part of the course.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Commutative Algebra II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 8410, MATH 8411, and MATH 8510 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course is a continuation of Commutative Algebra I. Basic concepts of Commutative Algebra will be assumed. In general, topics such as Cohen Macaulay rings, regularity, depth conditions and completion may be introduced as necessary. This can be a good introduction to Algebraic Geometry and Algebraic Number theory as well as starting research in commutative algebra.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Analytic Number Theory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This is a first course in analytic number theory at the graduate level. The course covers standard applications of real and complex analysis to the theory of numbers. Some prior experience with basic number theory and with analysis is highly recommended. The object of the course is to understand the numerous ways in which analytic techniques have been brought to bear on the study of numbers.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Algebraic Number Theory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This is a first course in algebraic number theory at the graduate level. But be careful! A large part of number theory (especially algebraic number theory) is not about numbers, but rather about more abstract concepts which have their origins in problems about numbers. The main object for the course is to learn various concepts and theorems necessary to understand the main theorems of both local and global class field theory.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Algebraic Geometry I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Affine and projective varieties and schemes; nullstellensatz; Zariski topology, morphisms and rational maps; divisors and linear systems; topics from curves, surfaces, Grassmann varieties; commutative algebra and homological algebra as needed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Algebraic Geometry II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of MATH 8615.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Algebraic Topology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Development of singular homology theory; reference to other homology and cohomology theories. Introduction to homological algebra.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Functional Analysis I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 4900 and instructor's consent or MATH 8420
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Linear topological spaces, Banach spaces, Hilbert spaces. Operator theory, including the Hahn-Banach, uniform boundedness and closed graph theorems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Harmonic Analysis I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: An introduction to Fourier Analysis in one and higher Dimensions. Topics include Fourier Series, conjugate functions, Fourier transforms, distributions, interpolation, and maximal functions.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Harmonic Analysis II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Singular integrals, Littlewood-Paley theory, Hardy spaces, bounded mean oscillation, weighted norm inequalities, boundary value problems, and analysis on groups.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Differentiable Manifolds and Riemannian Geometry
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Tensor product spaces and tensor fields on manifolds. Differentiation and integration of differential forms. Riemannian geometry and applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: General Topology I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to axiomatic theory of general topology. Continuous functions and homeomorphisms. Convergence in abstract topological spaces. Compact and locally compact spaces. Connectedness. Metrizable spaces.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Computer Aided Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Engineering Students only, or by departmental consentCorequisites: MATH 1500
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to 2D and 3D mechanical modeling techniques using computer-aided design (CAD) software. Topics include 3D part and assembly modeling, 2D part and assembly drawings, standards of engineering drawings, and basic animation and simulation.  Graded on A-F basis only.   Prerequisites/

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Computer Aided Design - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Engineering Students only, or by departmental consent. Honors eligibility requiredCorequisites: MATH 1500
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to 2D and 3D mechanical modeling techniques using computer-aided design (CAD) software. Topics include 3D part and assembly modeling, 2D part and assembly drawings, standards of engineering drawings, and basic animation and simulation.  Graded on A-F basis only.  Prerequisites/

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Programming and Software Tools
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in MATH 1700.  Restricted to Mechanical Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to the use of computers, programming, and software. Topics include MATLAB syntax and programming techniques, algorithm design, and programming with Excel spreadsheets.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Engineering Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in ENGINR 1200 and CHEM 1320. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The nature of the structure of engineering materials. The relationship of material structure to physical properties. Mechanical behavior of engineering materials. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Engineering Materials - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in ENGINR 1200 and CHEM 1320. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The nature of the structure of engineering materials. The relationship of material structure to physical properties. Mechanical behavior of engineering materials. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Thermodynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in PHYSCS 2750; restricted to MAE students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as ENGINR 2300). Fluid properties, work and heat, first law, second law, entropy, applications to vapor and ideal gas processes.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Manufacturing Processes
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 1100 and PHYSCS 2750. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to the fundamentals of manufacturing processes including forming, machining, casting, and welding, with emphasis on material processing, manufacturing equipment, and design considerations for manufacturing. Students will be trained in machine-shop safety, and will apply engineering graphics to design a simple part, and then use basic machining processes to manufacture the part in the machine shop. Graded on A-F only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in ENGINR 1200. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Basic fundamentals of particle and rigid body dynamics; energy and momentum methods.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Computational Methods for Engineering Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 2100; Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to numerical methods for linear system analysis, curve-fitting, integration and differentiation, and optimization.  The numerical methods are demonstrated through computer implementation and application to engineering design problems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Fluid Mechanics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 2300 or ENGINR 2300, Grade of C- or better in MAE 2600, Grade of C- or better in MATH 4100;  Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A basic course in fluid mechanics. Topics include: fluid properties, hydrostatics, conservation laws, infinitesimal and finite control volume analysis, Navier-Stokes equations, dimensional analysis, internal and external flows. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Manufacturing Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 1100 and ENGINR 2200.  Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as IMSE 3500). This course is an introduction to the engineering principles of manufacturing processes, ranging from traditional to state-of-the-art. The course will emphasize material processing, selection, and design considerations for manufacturing and will introduce critical aspects of manufacturing process engineering through a combination of lectures, videos, class discussions, and case studies to engage students. By the end of this course, the students are expected to learn the fundamentals of manufacturing and manufacturing processes. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Dynamic Systems and Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in PHYSCS 2760, MAE 2600 and MAE 3100 and MATH 4100. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Modeling and analysis of dynamic systems and introduction to feedback control.  Topics include dynamic modeling and response of mechanical, electrical, fluid, and thermal systems; and feedback control systems analysis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Dynamic Systems and Control - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 2600 and MAE 3100 and MATH 4100. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only.  Honors eligibility required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Modeling and analysis of dynamic systems and introduction to feedback control.  Topics include dynamic modeling and response of mechanical, electrical, fluid, and thermal systems; and feedback control systems analysis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Instrumentation and Measurements Laboratory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in MATH 4100, STAT 4710, ENGINR 2100 and ENGINR 2200; Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Design and reporting of experimental investigations.  Topics include instrument design equations, sources of error, and calibration.  Survey of instruments to measure: voltage, resistance, current, time, frequency, displacement, velocity, acceleration, strain, force, and torque.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Machine Element Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in ENGINR 2200, MAE 1100 and MAE 2200/MAE 2200W. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Application of stress and fatigue analyses to the design of machine elements such as fasteners, springs, shafts, and gears. Topics include selection of appropriate materials and machine elements. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Current and new technical developments in mechanical and aerospace engineering. Enrollment limited to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Problems in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
Aerospace Structures
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7210).  Fundamentals of the mechanics and design issues of aerospace structures.  Analysis of thin skins with stiffeners for external surfaces, bulkheads and frames for shape support, and fasteners for holding components together.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Materials Selection
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2200; Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7220).  Study of the physical and mechanical metallurgy of alloy systems of interest in engineering applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nanomaterials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2200 or equivalent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7230).  The primary goal of this course is to introduce students into the new field of nanostructured materials.  The emphasis of the course is to introduce the students into synthesis and characterization of nanomaterials, the behavior of such materials with nanoscale structures, and their technological applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nanomaterials - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2200 or equivalent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7230).  The primary goal of this course is to introduce students into the new field of nanostructured materials.  The emphasis of the course is to introduce the students into synthesis and characterization of nanomaterials, the behavior of such materials with nanoscale structures, and their technological applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Transport Phenomena in Materials Processing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as BIOL_EN 4231, CH_ENG 4231; cross-leveled with MAE 7231, CH_ENG 7231, BIOL_EN 7231).  Applications of fluid flow, heat transfer, and mass transfer in steady-state and unsteady-state materials processing with applications to metals, polymers, and ceramics.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Ceramic Materials and Processing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7232). Treatment of ceramics materials, structure, and ceramic processing with hands-on demonstration/labs. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Composite Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2200. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7250).  A survey of composite materials used in engineering emphasizing fiber-reinforced composites but including laminate and particulate composites.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nondestructive Evaluation of Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2200, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7270).  The role of nondestructive evaluation (NDE) in engineering is explored. Ultrasonic NDE is studied in detail. Labs are used to support the study of ultrasonic NDE. Other NDE techniques are surveyed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Finite Element Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in ENGINR 2200, MAE 3100, MAE students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 4680; cross-leveled with MAE 7280, CV_ENG 7680). The application of matrix operations, energy concepts and structural mechanics to the development of the finite element method. Application of finite element method to beams, frames and trusses.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Welding Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: senior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7290).  Welding is the most common method of joining similar as well as dissimilar materials.  This course thus introduces the basic science and engineering aspects of commonly used fusion and non-fusion welding processes.  Stress analysis and failure to welded joints is also introduced to develop safe and durable welded structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Heat Transfer
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 2300 or ENGINR 2300. Grade of C- or better in MAE 3400. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Fundamentals of conduction, convection and radiation. Use of nondimensional parameters. Theory and design of simple heat exchangers.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Intermediate Heat Transfer
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 4300 and Mechanical Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7310).  Advanced topics in conduction, convection, and radiation. Heat exchanges and their applications will also be analyzed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Design of Thermal Systems
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7320).  Thermal systems are simulated by mathematical models (often on a digital computer), followed by optimization. Supporting topics include: economics, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and optimization.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Design of Thermal Systems - Writing Intensive
Nanoscale Energy Transport
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7325). This course examines non-equilibrium energy processes from the vantage point of fundamental energy carriers. Topics include foundational solid state physics, statistical energy carrier distributions, density of states, and dispersion relationships. Energy transport will be discussed in terms of kinetic theory, the Landauer Formalism, and the Boltzmann Transport Equation. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Heating and Air Conditioning
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 4300 and MAE students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7340). General principles of thermal science applied to the design of environmental control systems. Topics covered include heating and cooling load calculations, annual operating and life cycle cost estimating, duct and pipe sizing, and equipment selection.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Energy Systems and Resources
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as ECE 4020, NU_ENG 4315; cross-leveled with ECE 7020, NU_ENG 7315, MAE 7371). Analysis of present energy usage in Missouri, USA and the world, evaluation of emerging energy technologies and trends for the future. Economics and environmental impact of the developed technologies.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Intermediate Thermodynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7380).  Topics from classical and statistical thermodynamics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aerospace Propulsion
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3400 and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7390).  Analysis of aircraft engines and spacecraft propulsion systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Intermediate Fluid Mechanics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7420).  Topics in potential and viscous flow theory, and computational fluid dynamics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Computational Fluid Dynamics and Heat Transfer
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7430).  Introduction to the principles and development of the finite difference approximations to the governing differential equations of viscous and inviscid fluid flow, as well as heat transfer. Introduction to discretization methods and the calculation of flow fields, convection, diffusion and conduction.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aerodynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7440).  Presents fundamentals of wing and airfoil theory for incompressible flow, including fluid kinematics and dynamics, potential flow, flow about a body, thin-airfoil theory, and finite wing.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Gas Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7450).  One dimensional compressible flow with and without friction and heat transfer. Isentropic flow and shock phenomenon in nozzles and diffusers.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Mechanics of Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in ENGINR 2200 and Junior standing in MAE or CV_ENG
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 4600; cross-leveled with MAE 7600 and CV_ENG 7600). Advanced concepts, methodology and solution procedures in mechanics of materials, including the theories of stress and strain in three-dimensions, linear stress-strain-temperature relations, inelastic material behavior and energy methods, as well as selected topics such as torsion, nonsymmetrical bending and shear center for thin-wall beam cross sections. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aircraft Flight Performance
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2600, MAE 3100, MAE 3400, and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7620).  Analysis of aircraft flight and aircraft performance metrics. Topics include airplane aerodynamics and propulsion, steady flight, range, endurance, take-off and landing, and aircraft maneuvers. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Space Flight Mechanics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2600, MAE 3100, and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7630). Analysis of spacecraft orbits and trajectories. Topics include orbital mechanics, orbital maneuvers, interplanetary missions, and entry flight mechanics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Spacecraft Attitude Dynamics and Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 3600
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7635). Spacecraft attitude representations; Spacecraft rotational kinematics and dynamics; Attitude determination and sensors; Environmental torques; Attitude stabilization strategies with gravity gradient, single and dual spins; Attitude control with momentum exchange devices. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Vibration Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MATH 4100 and MAE 2600
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 4660; cross-leveled with MAE 7660, CV_ENG 7660). Vibration theory and its application to mechanical systems. Topics include free and forced vibration analysis of single- and multi-degree of freedom systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to MEMS
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3600 and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7680).  The course will start with a survey of the widespread applications of MEMS sensors and actuators.  Micro fabrication methods used in conventional semiconductor industry will be introduced.  MEMS-specific process will be emphasized. Fundamental principles in electric circuits and mechanics will be reviewed.  Special attention is on mechanical issues encountered in MEMS design and fabrication.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aircraft Flight Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2600, MAE 3100, and MAE 3400 and Junior Standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7690). Introduction to atmospheric flight mechanics, Static stability, Dynamic stability, Aircraft coordinate systems, Aircraft equations of motion, Small perturbation Analysis and Linearization, Aerodynamic force and moment representations, Longitudinal motion, Lateral/directional motion, Introduction to flight controls. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Hydraulic Control Systems
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3400, MAE 3600, and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7710). Analysis of hydraulic control components and systems. Topics include pumps, valves, actuators, and industrial and mobile control systems.  May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Modern Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3600 and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7720).  Analysis and design of control systems using state-space methods.  Topics include controllability and observability, feedback control using pole-placement, state observers, optimal linear-quadratic feedback control, and optimal estimation. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Mechatronics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3600 and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7730).  Design of systems which require the integration of mechanical and electronic components.  Topics include microcontrollers, sensors, actuators, mechanical systems, real time control system programming, and modeling of electronic and mechanical systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Digital Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3600 and Junior standing in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7740).  Design and analysis of control systems using discrete-time methods.  Topics include z-transforms, sampling and reconstruction, stability analysis, and digital controller design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Classical Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as BIOL_EN 4310, ECE 4310; cross-leveled with MAE 7750, BIOL_EN 7310, ECE 7310 ). Study of feedback control design based on classical continuous-time methods.  Topics include performance specifications, stability analysis, root locus compensator design, and frequency domain analysis and compensator design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Materials and Manufacturing Laboratory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 2200 and MAE 2500 or MAE 3500, and MAE 3800, Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Experiments in materials characterization, material properties, and manufacturing processes. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Thermal Fluids Laboratory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 4300 and MAE 3800. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Applied thermal and fluid systems, such as HVAC and psychometrics, will be introduced.  Experiments conducted on thermal/fluid hardware components will be used to reinforce concepts.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Thermal Fluids Laboratory - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 3800 and MAE 4300. Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Applied thermal and fluid systems, such as HVAC and psychometrics, will be introduced. Experiments conducted on thermal/fluid hardware components will be used to reinforce concepts. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Mechanism Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MAE 2600 and MAE 3100.  Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students onlyRecommended: MAE 1100
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7910). Analysis of kinematics and dynamics of machinery.  Topics include design and selection of various mechanisms.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Mechanical Optimization
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3100, Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7930).  Introduction to mathematical programming techniques and applications to the design of mechanical systems and components.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aircraft Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in ENGINR 2200, MAE 3400, MAE 3600, and Junior standing in MAE
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 7940). Conceptual design of aircraft, from initial sizing and design layout to design analysis, optimization and trade studies.  Fundamental theories for aircraft design including sizing, aerodynamic forces, airfoil selection, wing loading, configuration layout payloads, propulsion systems, landing gear, aerospace structures, and cost analysis.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Senior Capstone Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3600 and MAE 3910
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Senior design experience. Topics include reliability, safety, manufacturability, economic, and environmental constraints; design case studies; and industrial design projects. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Senior Capstone Design - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MAE 3600 and MAE 3910
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Senior design experience. Topics include reliability, safety, manufacturability, economic, and environmental constraints; design case studies; and industrial design projects. Graded on A-F basis only.

Undergraduate Honors Research Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering
Undergraduate Honors Research Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering - Writing Intensive
Topics in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Current and new technical developments in mechanical and aerospace engineering. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aerospace Structures
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C or better in ENGINR 2200
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Fundamentals of the mechanics and design issues of aerospace structures.  Analysis of thin skins with stiffeners for external surfaces, bulkheads and frames for shape support, and fasteners for holding components together.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Materials Selection
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4220). Study of the physical and mechanical metallurgy of alloy systems of interest in engineering applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nanomaterials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4230). The primary goal of this course is to introduce students into the new field of nanostructured materials.  The emphasis of the course is to introduce the students into synthesis and characterization of nanomaterials, the behavior of such materials with nanoscale structures, and their technological applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Transport Phenomena in Materials Processing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MAE 2200, MAE 3400, MAE 4300 (or equivalent courses) and MATH 4100
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as BIOL_EN 7231, CH_ENG 7231; cross-leveled with MAE 4231, BIOL_EN 4231, CH_ENG 4231).  Applications of fluid flow, heat transfer, and mass transfer in steady-state and unsteady-state materials processing with applications to metals, polymers, and ceramics.  Graded A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Ceramic Materials and Processing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4232). Treatment of ceramics materials, structure, and ceramic processing with hands-on demonstration/labs. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Composite Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4250). A survey of composite materials used in engineering emphasizing fiber-reinforced composites but including laminate and particulate composites.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nondestructive Evaluation of Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4270). The role of nondestructive evaluation (NDE) in engineering is explored. Ultrasonic NDE is studied in detail. Labs are used to support the study of ultrasonic NDE. Other NDE techniques are surveyed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Finite Element Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: ENGINR 2200, MAE 3100, MAE students only.  Restricted to Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 7680; cross-leveled with MAE 4280, CV_ENG 4680). The application of matrix operations, energy concepts and structural mechanics to the development of the finite element method. Application of finite element method to beams, frames and trusses.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Welding Engineering
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4290). Welding is the most common method of joining similar as well as dissimilar materials.  This course thus introduces the basic science and engineering aspects of commonly used fusion and non-fusion welding processes.  Stress analysis and failure to welded joints is also introduced to develop safe and durable welded structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Intermediate Heat Transfer
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4310). Advanced topics in conduction, convection, and radiation. Heat exchanges and their applications will also be analyzed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Design of Thermal Systems
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4320). Thermal systems are simulated by mathematical models (often on a digital computer), followed by optimization. Supporting topics include: economics, heat transfer, thermodynamics, and optimization.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4380). Topics from classical and statistical thermodynamics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4390). Analysis of aircraft engines and spacecraft propulsion systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4420).Topics in potential and viscous flow theory, and computational fluid dynamics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4430). Introduction to the principles and development of the finite difference approximations to the governing differential equations of viscous and inviscid fluid flow, as well as heat transfer. Introduction to discretization methods and the calculation of flow fields, convection, diffusion and conduction.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Gas Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4450).  One-dimensional compressible flow with and without friction and heat transfer. Isentropic flow and shock phenomenon in nozzles and diffusers.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Microfluidics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4460). This course focuses on liquid transport in micro/nano fluidic devices and related electrohydrodynamics. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 7600; cross-leveled with MAE 4600 and CV_ENG 4600). https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4620). Analysis of aircraft flight dynamics and aircraft performance. Topics include airplane aerodynamics and propulsion, steady flight, flight performance, aircraft maneuvers, aircraft stability, and an introduction to flight controls. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4630).  Analysis of spacecraft motion. Topics include orbital dynamics, spacecraft attitude dynamics, satellite trajectory design, and spacecraft control system design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MATH 4100 and MAE 2600

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4720).  Analysis and design of control systems using state-space methods.  Topics include controllability and observability, feedback control using pole-placement, state observers, optimal linear-quadratic feedback control, and optimal estimation.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4730).  Design of systems which require the integration of mechanical and electronic components.  Topics include microcontrollers, sensors, actuators, mechanical systems, real time control system programming, and modeling of electronic and mechanical systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Mechanical Optimization
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4930).  Introduction to mathematical programming techniques and applications to the design of mechanical systems and components.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aircraft Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with MAE 4940). Conceptual design of aircraft, from initial sizing and design layout to design analysis, optimization, and trade studies.  Fundamental theories for aircraft design, including sizing, aerodynamic forces, airfoil selection, wing loading, configuration layout, payloads, propulsion systems, landing gear, aerospace structures, and cost analysis. Graded A-F basis only.

Problems in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
Graduate Seminar in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
Mechanical Behavior of Materials
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MAE 2200 and graduate standing in engineering, or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will cover the mechanical behavior of metallic, ceramic, polymeric, and composite materials and their relationships to the underlying microstructures.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Finite Element Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 8208). The concepts and fundamentals of the finite element method with applications to problems in solid and fluid mechanics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Microscale Heat Transfer
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Review of existing models. Concept of thermal lagging and the second-law admissibility. Applications to low temperatures, thermal processing of thin-film devices; amorphous materials; advanced composites.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Heat Transfer-Convection
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles of heat transfer by convection, review of boundary layer theory, laminar and turbulent heat transfer, temperature-dependent fluid properties, high velocity heat transfer and an introduction to mass transfer.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Heat Transfer-Conduction
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Distribution of temperature and temperature history within solids by the four essential methods of evaluation of these temperature fields.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Multiphase Heat Transfer
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Fundamentals and application of heat and mass transfer and fluid flow with phase change; melting and solidification, sublimation and vapor deposition, condensation, evaporation, nucleate and film boiling, two-phase flow.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Continuum Mechanics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 8320). Introductory course in the mechanics of continuous media. Basic concepts of stress, strain, constitutive relationships; conservation laws are treated using Cartesian tensor notation. Examples from both solid and fluid mechanics investigated.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Thermal Stresses
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: General equations of thermoelasticity, Constitutive equations of thermoelastoplasticity; Analytical and numerical analyses of thermal stresses in bars, beams, 3D media, 2D plane stress and strain media, cylinders, and spheres. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Theory of Plasticity
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 8360). Plastic yield conditions and stress-strain relations. Behavior of elastic-perfectly plastic members. Plain strain in plastic members.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Thermodynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced topics from classical thermodynamics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Dynamics of Structures
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: CV_ENG 8390 or equivalent, proficiency in digital computer programming, or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 8392). Study of the dynamic behavior of structures. Analysis of equivalent lumped parameter systems for the design of structures in a dynamic environment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Computational Heat Transfer and Fluid Dynamics
Introduction to Two Phase Flow
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: An introduction to the analysis of the mechanics and transport processes in two phase flows.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Turbulence
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: An introduction to the physical phenomena of turbulence, supported by mathematical and statistical descriptions. Especially appropriate for engineers involved in research of momentum, heat, and mass transport.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Heat Pipes
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Physics and interfacial phenomena, fundamentals of phase change heat transfer, mechanisms and heat transfer limitations of heat pipes, heat pipe fabrication and applications. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Manufacturing Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Design for manufacture methods, their capabilities and applications. Design of intelligent manufacturing systems using sensory systems and artificial intelligence techniques.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Dynamics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as CV_ENG 8620). Fundamental principles of advanced rigid body dynamics with applications. Special mathematical techniques including Lagrangian and Hamiltonian methods.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Robust Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MAE 4750, and MAE 8780 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Definition of the robust performance problem with the goal of achieving specified signal levels in the face of plant uncertainty; uncertainty and robustness, stabilization, design constraints, loopshaping, model matching and design for robust performance.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nonlinear Control
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Nonlinear systems analysis techniques including phase plane analysis, Lyapunov theory. Control design including feedback linearization, sliding control, and adaptive control.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Modular Machine Tool Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course introduces necessary concepts and tools for modular machine tool design.  Students will learn how to apply mechanical design knowledge and commercially available subassemblies and parts to design modular machine tools for mass production application.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Mechanical System Modeling and Optimization
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MAE 3600 and MAE 4980.  Seniors will require consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Calculus of variations is introduced as a basic tool.  Hamilton's Principle is used for system modeling.  Numerical solution methods are used for dynamic simulation.  Genetic algorithm and other algorithms are applied for system optimization.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research-Masters Thesis in Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
The Science of Sex, Drugs and Rock'n'Roll
Toxins, The Good, The Bad, and the Beautiful
Toxins, The Good, The Bad, and the Beautiful - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: In this course, the students will explore toxins. We will discuss how toxins are formed, the "value" of the toxin to the organism that makes it, how the toxin is delivered, the effect of the toxin on the target animal and on humans. In addition, we will discuss how toxins have led to new therapies and drugs. We will also analyze some famous cases of apparent toxin poisoning. In all cases, the students will be urged to critically evaluate the data and the theories and encouraged to think of novel uses of toxins and of experiments that would provide important new information about the toxins and their effects.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Toxins, The Good, The Bad, and the Beautiful - Writing Intensive
Bodily Fluids and Functions - Writing Intensive
Elements of Physiology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Beginning course for sophomore and above designed to cover the basic functional aspects of major organ systems of the body.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Elements of Physiology -  Honors

Fat, bone, digestion, nutrition, appetite and brain health will be emphasized for health reform and updates for nervous, muscle, heart, vasculature, liver, renal, lung and endocrine systems with analysis for preventative medicine.   May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.

Fat, bone, digestion, nutrition, appetite and brain health will be emphasized for health reform and updates for nervous, muscle, heart, vasculature, liver, renal, lung and endocrine systems with analysis for preventative medicine.   May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.
