https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Honors eligibility required.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 1000
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Origins and development of child behavior, emphasizing basic physical, cognitive, affective and social processes, and theory and research rather than application or guidance. Cannot receive credit for more than one of the following: PSYCH 2410, H_D_FS 2420 or H_D_FS 3420 or ESC_PS 2500.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Survey of Psychopathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 1000
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Basic survey of maladaptive human behavior and experience, including personality disorders, alcohol and drug abuse, anxiety and mood disorders, sexual dysfunctions, and thought disorders.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Sexuality
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 1000
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of psychological research on sexual expression and reproductive behavior, including gender identity and sexual orientation.  Emphasis on cross-cultural comparison of normative behaviors, sexual and reproductive rights, and sexual morality. Students will explore their own beliefs and values in the context of prevalent American and world norms.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Minds, Brains, and Machines
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: sophomore standing required.  May be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 1000
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as LINGST 2820 and PHIL 2820).  Cognitive science is a many-splendored thing. It draws on a variety of disciplines, including psychology, neuroscience, computer science, linguistics, anthropology, and philosophy. The purpose of this course is to introduce the central questions of cognitive science, the conceptual and empirical tools used to investigate those questions, and some of the answers that have emerged so far. After an initial overview of the foundations of the cognitive-scientific enterprise as a whole, we will see what particular sectors of it have to say about mental capacities such as language, categorization, reasoning, social cognition, and consciousness.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human-Companion Animal Interaction
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: May be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 1000
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Exploration of historical and theoretical bases of human-companion animal interaction (HAI), the nature issues, and clinical applications of HAI. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Psychology-Behavioral Science - Writing Intensive
Research Methods in Psychology I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course is restricted to psychology majors with sophomore standing and above
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to scientific reasoning, assessing validity and reliability in research, and basic research methods. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research Methods in Psychology I- Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000; Honors eligibility required.  This course is restricted to psychology majors with sophomore standing and above
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to scientific reasoning, assessing validity and reliability in research, and basic research methods. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research Methods in Psychology II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000, and a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010 and STAT 1200 or exemption.  This course is restricted to junior and senior psychology majors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of PSYCH 3010 and required for all further labs in psychology. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Theories of Learning
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Discusses classical issues and theories in learning and conditioning, and considers them in contemporary form.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Theories of Learning - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Discusses classical issues and theories in learning and conditioning, and considers them in contemporary form.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Decisions, Values and Choice
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of factors influencing choices and decisions. Topics include cause and effect decisions, values and ethical considerations, outcome likelihood, biases and heuristics, concept formation, self-control and impulsiveness, and social factors.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Decisions, Values and Choice - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  Honors eligibility required.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of factors influencing choices and decisions. Topics include cause and effect decisions, values and ethical considerations, outcome likelihood, biases and heuristics, concept formation, self-control and impulsiveness, and social factors.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Decisions, Values and Choice - Honors/Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  Honors eligibility required.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of factors influencing choices and decisions. Topics include cause and effect decisions, values and ethical considerations, outcome likelihood, biases and heuristics, concept formation, self-control and impulsiveness, and social factors.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cognitive Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A survey of psychological theory and research on human cognition.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Memory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Surveys research on human memory, including basic laboratory studies with normal subjects as well as research on amnesia and other memory impairments, life-span memory development, and the cognitive neuroscience of memory.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Perception and Thought
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Covers research on various aspects of mental life: language, problem-solving, decision-making, sensory perception.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Intergroup Relations
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Provides an overview of the social psychological literature on stereotyping, prejudice, discrimination, and intergroup relations. Students learn theoretical frameworks and research findings regarding the development and maintenance of intergroup conflict.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Positive Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000, This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course introduces students to the science of positive psychology, including its origin and the historical imbalances it addresses within the broader field of psychology. A wide variety of topics are covered, including happiness, materialism, purpose, flow, courage, humility, positive emotions, curiosity, mindfulness, savoring, gratitude, forgiveness, personal strengths, resilience, and compassion. Psychology majors cannot receive credit for both PSYCH 3350 and ESC_PS 4200.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Positive Motivation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Examination of motivation through the study of Self-Determination, Self-Concordance and Goal Systems, as well as Attribution and Achievement goal theories from a theoretical and applied perspective.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: The Science of Mindfulness
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000 and a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010. This course may be restricted to psychology majors through early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: To gain breadth and depth in understanding the empirical research on mindfulness and contemplative practices. To do well in the course, students must master the substantive content, psychological methodology, APA-style writing, peer-review, and presentation skills.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: The Science of Mindfulness - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000 and a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010. This course may be restricted to psychology majors through early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: To gain breadth and depth in understanding the empirical research on mindfulness and contemplative practices. To do well in the course, students must master the substantive content, psychological methodology, APA-style writing, peer-review, and presentation skills.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cognitive Development in Childhood
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Theories and research on cognitive development in childhood.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social Development in Childhood
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of children's social and emotional development (infancy-adolescence), includes changes in social domains, impact of social functioning on subsequent development, and influence of interpersonal contexts (e.g., family, peers, community) on children's development.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social Development in Childhood - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  Honors eligibility required.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of children's social and emotional development (infancy-adolescence), includes changes in social domains, impact of social functioning on subsequent development, and influence of interpersonal contexts (e.g., family, peers, community) on children's development.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social Development in Childhood - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of children's social and emotional development (infancy-adolescence), includes changes in social domains, impact of social functioning on subsequent development, and influence of interpersonal contexts (e.g., family, peers, community) on children's development.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Women's Professional Development
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to undergraduate psychology majors through early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This class takes a lifespan developmental perspective in regards to understanding challenges in women's professional development. Topics include: perceptions and stereotypes of successful women, division of labor in families (housework versus paid work), motherhood and the work place, social policies for working parents, girls' and boys' interests in STEM professions, and gender and workplace economics (starting salaries, negotiation, the gender pay gap).

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Women's Professional Development - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000; Honors eligibility required. This course may be restricted to undergraduate psychology majors through early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This class takes a lifespan developmental perspective in regards to understanding challenges in women's professional development. Topics include: perceptions and stereotypes of successful women, division of labor in families (housework versus paid work), motherhood and the work place, social policies for working parents, girls' and boys' interests in STEM professions, and gender and workplace economics (starting salaries, negotiation, the gender pay gap).

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology of Gender
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000 with a grade of C- or better
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course covers the psychology of gender, with a focus on similarities and differences between women and men.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Clinical Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Comprehensive survey of the field's historical roots, research methods, concepts of abnormality, assessment and intervention methods; also specialties that constitute clinical psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Clinical Psychology - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Comprehensive survey of the field's historical roots, research methods, concepts of abnormality, assessment and intervention methods; also specialties that constitute clinical psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Emotion Regulation and the Brain
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course takes a ground-up approach to understand the nature of emotion regulation and dysregulation. It describes the nature of commonly used emotion regulation techniques and the evidence that supports them. Major emotion regulation mechanisms involved in emotional disorders and in their treatment are examined.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cross-Cultural Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: We will adopt a psychological approach to the study of the cross-cultural experience. We will spend our time investigating how culture affects and determines human, behavior, thoughts, emotions and interactions with others.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cross-Cultural Psychology - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: We will adopt a psychological approach to the study of the cross-cultural experience. We will spend our time investigating how culture affects and determines human, behavior, thoughts, emotions and interactions with others.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology at the Movies
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: We will watch, discuss, and interpret films from a psychological-social perspective.  Connections will be made between cinematic content and contemporary theory and research in psychology and diversity studies.  The focus of this course will be on watching and discussing films, as well as on reading and writing about psychological aspects of film.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology at the Movies - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: We will watch, discuss, and interpret films from a psychological-social perspective. Connections will be made between cinematic content and contemporary theory and research in psychology and diversity studies. The focus of this course will be on watching and discussing films, as well as on reading and writing about psychological aspects of film. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Health Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A hands-on approach to the study of health psychology including research on a topic of current relevance to the field.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Individual Differences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Surveys individual and group differences.  Contributions of various factors to variations in behavior.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Law and Psychological Science
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This survey course examines the interactions of law and psychology across the justice system.  Emphasis is placed on how psychological research does (and does not) inform important legal issues.  Requirements may include an in-class team debate of relevant controversy in law.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Forensic Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to forensic psychology. Students will learn how psychological concepts, theories, and research findings are applied in law enforcement, court, and in correctional settings.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: African-American Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors through Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (Same as BL_STU 3100 and ESC_PS 3100). The research, theories and paradigms developed to understand the attitudes, behaviors and psychosocial realities of African-Americans are discussed. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Music and the Mind
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as SLHS 3890). This course examines music as a universal human behavior, with an emphasis on the perceptual, cognitive and neural processes that underlie it, and their origins in evolution and development.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Psychology-Behavioral Science - Writing Intensive
Topics in Psychology Capstone - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Department Consent required, honors eligibility required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students review, evaluate and conduct research on selected topics in psychology. The particular topic will vary by semester and instructor. Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Psychology Capstone - Honors/Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Department Consent required, honors eligibility required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students review, evaluate and conduct research on selected topics in psychology. The particular topic will vary by semester and instructor. Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Psychology Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students review, evaluate and conduct research on selected topics in psychology. The particular topic will vary by semester and instructor. Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Perception
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with PSYCH 7110).  Data and contemporary theories of perception in all of the senses, with emphasis on visual and auditory perception.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Physiological Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: An introduction to neuroscience with an overview of the relation between the brain and behavior.  Topics include intercellular communication, drugs and reward, emotions and stress psychoimmunology, psychopathology, nervous system development and repair, perception, cognition, learning and memory.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Animal Behavior and Cognition
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The purpose of this course is to introduce the basic findings, concepts and principles of animal behavior, associative learning, memory and cognition.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cognitive Neuroscience
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 2210 and PSYCH 4210
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The neural basis of human information processing in memory, attention, perception, imagery, movement, and language.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social Cognition
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to undergraduate Psychology majors during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The overarching goal of this course is to provide an overview of current research and theory in social cognition. If there is a running theme to this course, it is in the use of "top down" processes in how we construct an understanding of the world around us. That is, we use our past experiences and memories to interpret new experiences, people and behavior. This fact does not dictate whether that understanding is accurate or not. However, social psychologists have historically been interested in the ways that this process leads to errors or biases in a vast array of human endeavors. This perspective has had a strong impact on the trajectory of social cognition.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Sex Differences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course covers the evolution of sex differences and hormonal and environmental influences on their expressions in nonhuman species.  These insights are used to understand human sex differences in mate choices, emotions, development, brain and cognition, and in modern societies.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology of Youths' Close Relationships
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 2410 and PSYCH 3430
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will provide an examination of the close, interpersonal relationships humans typically encounter and create over the first two and a half decades of life and the ways in which they influence youth development and well-being.  It will examine the ways in which relationships with parents, siblings, friends, and romantic partners develop and change from infancy through young adulthood, including theoretical perspectives, research methods, relationship forms and processes, and contextual influences on relationships.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language and Development in Infancy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as SLHS 4840; cross-leveled with SLHS 7840, PSYCH 7442). Overview of theory and research on the foundations and development of language in infancy (0 to 2 years), with an emphasis on relevant, interrelated areas of development, individual differences, early recognition of delay, and assessment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Behavior Genetics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000; This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: Grade of C or better in PSYCH 3010 and STAT 1200 or higher
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with PSYCH 7520). The study of genetic influences on behavioral traits such as mood, personality, intelligence, mental health, or activity level.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research in Psychopathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Intensive survey and evaluation of the psychological literature on abnormal behavior, emphasizes experimental and explanatory approaches.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Emotional Disorders in Childhood and Adolescence
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 2410
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Surveys disturbed behavioral development during childhood and adolescence, emphasizing factors that produce deviation from normal developmental patterns.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Schizophrenia
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will examine one of the most severe, debilitating, and complex mental disorders.  We will review the major symptoms and clinical features of schizophrenia, explore possible causes of Psychology disorder, and critically assess treatments for the disorder.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychosis and the Brain
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The goal of this course is to better understand the nature of psychosis that occurs in psychotic disorders such as Schizophrenia and in many other disorders/conditions. The course will take a translational approach to understanding psychosis, focusing on neural mechanisms and their role in behavior. The nature of psychotic symptoms in psychotic disorders, in non-psychotic disorders and in the general population will be examined.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Behavioral and Technology Addictions
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The inclusion of Gambling Disorder as the first recognized behavioral addiction in the DSM-5 and has brought renewed attention to the broader spectrum of other behavioral compulsions. This online course provides a conceptualization of behavioral addictions and a brief overview of the varied forms of addictive behaviors and treatments, including gambling, online gaming, food addiction, pornography addiction, sex addiction, compulsive shopping, internet addiction and a variety of impulse control disorders, among others. Attention is given to the relationship between behavioral addictions and substance addictions across a number of domains, including their natural history, phenomenology, comorbidity, genetic predisposition, neurobiological mechanisms, and response to treatment. Developments in the conceptualization, prevention, and intervention are addressed, as well, in relation to the rapidly evolving field of behavioral addictions. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Pediatric Neuropsychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early RegistrationRecommended: PSYCH 1000, PSYCH 2210 or PSYCH 4240
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: introduction to the field of pediatric neuropsychology and the study of individuals with early brain dysfunction.  Common central nervous system disorders of childhood (e.g. autism, ADHD, epilepsy) will be discussed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Externalizing Spectrum Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000. This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The purpose of this course is to provide an overview of the symptoms, etiology, and treatment of psychiatric disorders that fall within the externalizing spectrum, including Attention-Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, Oppositional Defiant Disorder, Conduct Disorder, Alcohol and other Substance Use Disorders, and Antisocial Personality Disorder. This course will attempt to provide an overview of key issues and topics related to the classification of psychiatric disorders and how research in this area has led to current conceptualizations of the externalizing spectrum. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology of Women
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of current theories and research relating to the psychology of women.  Topics include gender stereotyping, psychological sex differences, achievement motivation in women, and women and mental health.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: The History of Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 1000.  This course may be restricted to Undergraduate Psychology Majors during Early Registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with PSYCH 7840).  Historical foundations of contemporary psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Developmental Psychology Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduces students to developmental research methods through relevant readings and by students conducting original research. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Developmental Psychology Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduces students to developmental research methods through relevant readings and by students conducting original research. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Animal Learning Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of principles of animal behavior and animal learning and cognition. The course includes laboratory projects on research in animal behavior and animal learning. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Animal Learning Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of principles of animal behavior and animal learning and cognition. The course includes laboratory projects on research in animal behavior and animal learning. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Cognition Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students review, evaluate and conduct research on various aspects of human cognition. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Cognition Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students review, evaluate and conduct research on various aspects of human cognition. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology of Art Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will examine how the psychological processes of sensation and perception influence the experience of beauty - music, cuisine, movies, dance and other artistic endeavors. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology of Art Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will examine how the psychological processes of sensation and perception influence the experience of beauty - music, cuisine, movies, dance and other artistic endeavors. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social/Personality Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Experimental methods course emphasizing research in social psychology. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social/Personality Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Experimental methods course emphasizing research in social psychology. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Independent Research Capstone I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010 and STAT 1200 (or its equivalent).  Instructor consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Individual thesis on a topic selected with a faculty advisor. Student projects are carried out over the course of two semesters (with PSYCH 4977) and presented as posters in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. For students who plan to pursue a PhD in Psychology or Neuroscience. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Honors Research Capstone I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010 and STAT 1200 (or its equivalent). Honors eligibility required.  Instructor consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Individual thesis on a topic selected with a faculty advisor. Student projects are carried out over the course of two semesters (with PSYCH 4977HW) and presented as posters in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. For students who plan to pursue a PhD in Psychology or Neuroscience. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Honors Research Capstone I - Honors/Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010 and STAT 1200 (or its equivalent).  Honors eligibility required.  Instructor consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Individual thesis on a topic selected with a faculty advisor. Student projects are carried out over the course of two semesters (with PSYCH 4977HW) and presented as posters in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. For students who plan to pursue a PhD in Psychology or Neuroscience. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Independent Research Capstone I - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3010 and STAT 1200 (or its equivalent).  Instructor consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Individual thesis on a topic selected with a faculty advisor. Student projects are carried out over the course of two semesters (with PSYCH 4977W) and presented as posters in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. For students who plan to pursue a PhD in Psychology or Neuroscience.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Independent Research Capstone II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who completed PSYCH 4976 and have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Instructor Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of PSYCH 4976. Completion of research project, presentation of poster in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have completed PSYCH 4976. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Honors Research Capstone II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who completed PSYCH 4976 and have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020; Honors eligibility required. Instructor Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of PSYCH 4976H. Completion of research project, presentation of poster in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress.  Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing, honors eligibility, a cumulative GPA of 3.5, who have completed PSYCH 4976H. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Honors Research Capstone II - Honors/Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing, honors eligibility, a cumulative GPA of 3.5, who have completed PSYCH 4976HW. Instructor Consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of PSYCH 4976HW. Completion of research project, presentation of poster in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing, honors eligibility, a cumulative GPA of 3.5, who have completed PSYCH 4976HW. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Independent Research Capstone II - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have completed PSYCH 4976W. Instructor Consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of PSYCH 4976W. Completion of research project, presentation of poster in a spring conference. Weekly class discussions of student progress. Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have completed PSYCH 4976W. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Psychology Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Department consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students work at assigned agencies to gain "real-world" experience in the practice of psychology and attend regularly scheduled class meetings in order to integrate their academic knowledge with their practical experience.   Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Judgement and Decision Making Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course examines the psychology of human judgement and decision-making. We will discuss major theories, methods and basic experimental findings and identify how those findings are being used to develop public policy or in applied settings. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Judgment and Decision Making Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course examines the psychology of human judgment and decision-making. We will discuss major theories, methods and basic experimental findings and identify how those findings are being used to develop public policy or in applied settings.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Relationships Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students design a study, collect data, and describe their research on some aspect of human relationships. Emphasis on survey research techniques. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Relationships Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Department Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students design a study, collect data, and describe their research on some aspect of human relationships. Emphasis on survey research techniques. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Promoting Social Justice, Diversity, and Inclusion Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Department Consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course is an advanced exploration of diversity and social justice in the United States and provides students with a framework for understanding specific forms and the interlocking systems of oppression; a process to explore how oppression affects our lives; a pedagogical framework for teaching and training about concepts of oppression and diversity; and an application of these ideologies and skills in community settings. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Health Psychology Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The objectives of this course are to understand the psychosocial processes that influence health and health care delivery. Topics to be examined are the psychophysiological and sociocultural bases of health and illness; pain and healing; adaptation to chronic illness; stress; personality and illness; death, dying, and grief; substance use; health-promoting behaviors; patient adherence; physician-patient communication; and using health care.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Perception and Action Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Together we will explore how the brain creates our conscious experience of, and controls our actions in, the world. A variety of weekly assignments will challenge you to improve your written communication skills. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Perception and Action Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Together we will explore how the brain creates our conscious experience of, and controls our actions in, the world. A variety of weekly assignments will challenge you to improve your written communication skills. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cross-Cultural Psychology Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course adopts a psychological approach to the study of the cross-cultural experience. It will investigate how culture affects and determines human behavior, thoughts, emotions, and interactions. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cross-Cultural Psychology Capstone - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will adopt a psychological approach to the study of the cross-cultural experience. It will investigate how culture affects and determines human behavior, thoughts, emotions, and interactions with others. Students will be part of public scholarship and have opportunities for public presentations of projects. Graded on A-F basis only. Enrollment is limited to senior Psychology majors who have completed PSYCH 1000; PSYCH 3020 with a grade of C or better; honors eligibility required.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cross-Cultural Psychology Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course adopts a psychological approach to the study of the cross-cultural experience. It will investigate how culture affects and determines human behavior, thoughts, emotions, and interactions. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Medical Decision Making Capstone
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will learn how patients make decisions about their own healthcare and how doctors make diagnostic and treatment decisions for their patients. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Medical Decision Making Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will learn how patients make decisions about their own healthcare and how doctors make diagnostic and treatment decisions for their patients. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: The Science of Intergroup Relations Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course focuses on research methods and scientific findings relevant to intergroup relations, including racism, sexism, stereotyping, discrimination and other related topics.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Pain and the Brain Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Departmental Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students taking this course will conduct empirical research on psychological and behavioral factors that are associated with the various aspects of pain. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: The Science of Mindfulness Capstone - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Enrollment limited to psychology majors with senior standing who have a grade of C- or better in PSYCH 3020. Department Consent Required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will gain breadth and depth in understanding the scientific empirical research on mindfulness and contemplative practices. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language and Development in Infancy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as SLHS 7840; cross-leveled with PSYCH 4442, SLHS 4840). Overview of theory and research on the foundations and development of language in infancy (0 to 2 years), with an emphasis on relevant, interrelated areas of development, individual differences, early recognition of delay, and assessment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Behavior Genetics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with PSYCH 4520). The study of genetic influences on behavioral traits such as mood, personality, intelligence, mental health, or activity level.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: The History of Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with PSYCH 4840).  Historical foundations of contemporary psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cognitive Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focuses on basic research on human perception, memory, attention, language, and thought.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Functional Neuroscience
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Basic techniques, data and theory in the neurosciences applied to the study of psychopathology, psychopharmacology, neural development, brain damage, memory and other areas of "behavior."

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychology of Development
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles, theories, research in normal human development.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cognitive Development
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as H_D_FS 8420). An introduction to central theories and issues in the study of cognitive development in infancy and childhood. Emphasis is on major theoretical frameworks for studying cognitive development, and topics such as perception, memory, language, categorization, and reasoning.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Developmental Psychopathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Etiology, diagnosis, and treatment of disordered behavior from infancy through adolescence. Emphasizes contrasting theories and research issues.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Adult Psychopathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Problems of etiology, diagnosis, treatment in psychopathology. Considers theory, research, case histories.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Motivation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Survey of historical and contemporary theories and models of human motivation.  Major emphasis on different levels of motivational analysis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Personality Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Graduate-level introduction to the field of personality psychology, including readings and discussion of both classic and contemporary works.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: General Linear Models in Psychology I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: undergraduate course in statistics; concurrent enrollment in PSYCH 8730; instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles of interval estimation and hypothesis testing, scalar and matrix forms of simple and multiple regression with continuous and categorical predictors, regression diagnostics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: General Linear Models in Psychology II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 8710 or equivalent, concurrent enrollment in PSYCH 8730; instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Complex analysis of variance; experimental design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social and Behavioral Sciences in Public Health
Studies in Experimental Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 4972 or PSYCH 4973; departmental consent for repetition; instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Critical consideration of selected research in neuroscience and cognitive psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Conditioning and Learning: Theory and Application
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Basic principles of operant and Pavlovian learning, motivation, extinction, inhibition, avoidance, etc., and their application to human behavior and it's modification.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Learning and Memory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Current theory and research in the area of human learning and memory will be investigated. A major component of the course will involve the critical review of existing literature in this area.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychopharmacology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Basic principles of drug action on the nervous system, the theory and clinical use of the various psychotherapeutic drugs, drug abuse and its treatment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Neuropsychology Seminar
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: In this course students will analyze published cases in the neuropsychology literature.  By studying how behavioral and mental processes break down, the supposition is that one can infer how intact processes must have been constructed, and how a brain supports them.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Seminar on fMRI
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Fundamentals of MRI and its application to brain imaging, including experimental design, analysis and contemporary issues.  During the lab component, students will use FSL and other software to analyze fMRI data and will design and implement their own fMRI experiments.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Neural Systems
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The course provides in-depth coverage of the neurophysiology, neuroanatomy, and function of the brain. Course lectures and discussions cover the brain and its systems in a "bottom-up" sequence starting with basic sensory pathways and concluding with higher cognitive functions. The course also includes hands-on laboratory sessions, which include dissection component. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Theories of Social Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Intensive review of classic and contemporary concepts and theories of social psychology; emphasizes readings from primary sources. PhD candidates only. Required for all PhD candidates in social psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social Psychology Methodology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced study of experimental methods in social psychological research.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Field Research Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced course in research methods and designs commonly used in field settings; theoretical, ethical, and pragmatic issues that arise in field settings are considered; emphasis is on learning and skill acquisition through a series of hands-on assignments.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Women's Professional Development
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This class takes a lifespan developmental perspective in regards to understanding challenges in women's professional development. Topics include: perceptions and stereotypes of successful women, division of labor in families (housework versus paid work), motherhood and the work place, social policies for working parents, girls' and boys' interests in STEM professions, and gender and workplace economics (starting salaries, negotiation, the gender pay gap).  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Orientations in Psychotherapy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The introductory psychotherapy course for students in the clinical psychology doctoral program.  The focus of the course is on development of knowledge and skills in the following four areas: (1) Theory and practice of contemporary (brief) psychotherapy; (2) Basic interviewing skills; (3) Psychotherapy research and empirically supported treatments; and (4) The role and impact of managed care in contemporary psychotherapy.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychometrics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to concepts and issues essential to psychological assessment including psychometrics, test construction, controversies in psychological testing, behavioral assessment, and structured interviewing.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Orientations to Clinical Assessment
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Topics include psychometric principles, intelligence testing, objective and projective personality testing and behavioral assessment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Child Assessment
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to clinical instruments, techniques and problems in the psychological assessment of children.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Ethical and Professional Issues II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Legal issues, state and national codes, ethical decision-making, dangerousness, ethical clinical treatment issues, mandated reporting, and ethics in specialized clinical settings.  This course is the second in a sequence for clinical psychology doctoral students.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Intervention with Children
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to theory, research and practice in the area of behavior change with children and adolescents.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Family and Group Process
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Theory, intervention, and research in the areas of family and group dynamics.  Emphasis on family therapy approaches.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Research Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focus on research design with emphasis on active critique of methodological challenges (e.g., subject selection, control groups, multimodal measures, and treatment issues), includes lecture and active review or research.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Alcohol and Addiction Studies
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Intensive seminar on alcohol research primarily intended for alcohol research training fellows.  Covers a range of topics of interest to psychologist, including pharmacology, research methods, genetics, diagnosis, expectancies, and treatment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Multivariate Statistics in Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Multivariate statistical methods, including multivariate analysis of variance, discriminant analysis, principal component analysis, and elements of matrix algebra, as applied to problems in psychology.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Multilevel Modeling
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: instructor's consent, a graduate course in regression analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to random coefficient multilevel modeling of clustered data. Topics include two- and three-level models, estimation techniques, computing options, model fitting issues, advanced model applications, and growth modeling.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Latent Variable Models in Statistical Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Covers Matrix Algebra fundamentals, Factor Rotation, Communality Estimation techniques, High Order and Dynamic Factor Models, Path Analysis, Use of computer programs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Psychological Process Models
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PSYCH 8710 and PSYCH 8720 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Examines mathematical and statistical models of cognition and perception.  Emphasis on modeling basics such as estimation, hypothesis testing, and assessment of fit.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Structural Equation Modeling
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Growth Mixture Models, Dynamic Factor models, and nonlinear structural models.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Categorical Data Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will provide an applied introduction to the most important methods for analyzing categorical data.  Topics include; logistic regression modeling Poisson regression modeling, multinomial sampling, and classic analysis of contingency tables.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cluster Analysis and Network Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The course covers traditional and modern clustering techniques (hierarchical, partitioning, and mixture modeling), both from an algorithmic and modeling perspective. Several types of data types are explored, including traditional two-mode data sets and network structures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Bayesian Psychometrics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The goal of this class is to acquaint students with Bayesian psychometric models that are popular in psychology, education, and the social sciences. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced History of Psychology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced course in history of psychology designed to show how general philosophical models of mind and behavior have been linked to doctrines of mental health and pathology and to theories of social behavior.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Public Affairs - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Selected topics in public affairs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Public Affairs
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Select current topics in public affairs. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Scientific and Technological Aspects Terrorism and Counter Terrorism
Topics in Public Affairs
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Select current topics in public affairs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Public and Nonprofit Management
Sustainable Energy Policy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PUB_AF 8177Recommended: Principles of Economics, Instructor's permission
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course examines the concept of sustainability as it applies to energy production and consumption, and explores policy options for achieving sustainable energy use.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research Methods and Inquiry in Public Affairs I
Research Methods and Inquiry in Public Affairs II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Advanced topics and applications in research methods for public affairs.  Topics include: multivariate analysis and other advanced quantitative techniques; evaluation of policy research products.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Economic Analysis for Public Policy - Mid Career
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Application of tools of economic analysis to understand and interpret the behavior of government, consumers and producers.  Sources of economic inefficiency, including market failures and limitations , and policy solutions.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Regional Development Issues and Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as AAE 8350).  Examines theories of regional growth and development and methods for analysis with applications to current policy issues.  Topics include firm location, new economic geography and agglomeration theory, clusters, human capital, migration, social capital, tax and development incentives, and sustainable regional development.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Public Program Evaluation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Covers implementation and outcome evaluation models, research design strategies, and data collection methods used to assess the effectiveness of public programs and means of their improvement.  Graded on A/F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Public Policy Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PUB_AF 8180 or equivalent, or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Uses economic logic and statistical techniques to design, analyze and evaluate public policy. Applies survey research, cost/benefit analysis, forecasting, regression analysis, trend analysis, time series methods, and other analytic techniques to policy decision. Graded on A-F basis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Human Resources Management and Development in Public and Nonprofit Sector
Strategic Management of Public Service Organizations
Organizational Change in a Community and Global Context
Budgeting and Financial Management in the Nonprofit Sector
Grant Writing II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Provides students with knowledge regarding the process of seeking grant funding. Students will work in small groups to complete a full-blown state or federal grant proposal. They will experience the peer review process both as applicant and reviewer. The course will cover a variety of funding sources and a range of funding types to provide students with an information base for preparing future grant applications.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Sponsor Relationships
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Provides students with knowledge of the landscape and culture of grant seeking with an emphasis on understanding how private and public sector sponsors are in many ways, significantly different enterprises.  Students will gain an understanding of the pivotal role relationships play in grant seeking and gain an appreciation of the particularities and rigors of both public and private grant seeking.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Grant Award Management
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Provides students with knowledge regarding the process and policies entailed in managing grant awards.  Course content includes federal OMB circulars, basic human resource issues, project management strategies, reporting obligations, and project close-out.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Policies and Institutions of the European Union
International Comparative Rural Policy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as AAE 8860, NAT_R 8860).  Compares the rural policy objectives and implementation strategies of various countries, and assesses these policies in terms of economic, social, environmental outcomes and their implications for international relations. Includes 2-weeks of study Abroad. May be repeated for credit. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Directed Individual Study
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Supervised readings and research in area of doctoral specialization.  Student must submit formal written proposal to doctoral supervising faculty member prior to registration.  May be repeated up to 6 hours.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Governance and Public Affairs
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PUB_AF 8150, PhD standing or permission of professor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Examines theories of governance, the role of the state and other social institutions.  Other topics include administrative reform, the new public management, and the emergence of the multi-sector public service.  International comparative dimensions emphasized. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Organization Studies in Public Affairs
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Examines theories of public and nonprofit organizations, including classical and contemporary perspectives in organization science; individual and group behavior; leadership, power and influence; organization design and structure; and organizational culture. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Policy Theory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This seminar examines theories on the policy process, institutions, and delegation of power that influence public policy.  Topics covered may include agenda setting, policy design, implementation, legislative decision-making, state political institutions, and federalism.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Research Methods for Public Affairs I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PUB_AF 8180 or equivalent, PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Focuses on multiple regression analysis, the implications and treatment of serial correlation, heteroskedasticity, multicollinerarity, specification error, and measurement error.  Students estimate models, use diagnostic information, and interpret and present findings for public affairs. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Research Methods for Public Affairs II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PUB_AF 9180 or equivalent, PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The seminar examines statistical modeling tools for limited dependent variables and complex data situations, such as time-series cross-sectional data, clustered observations, and multilevel data.  Other topics include simultaneous equation modes and instrument variable in public affairs.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Logics of Inquiry in Public Affairs
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course examines the philosophical foundations of social inquiry public affairs.  Topics include investigation of epistemological and methodological issues in development and use of social research, and exploration of the theoretical underpinnings of multiple paradigms in public affairs.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Public Affairs Research and Professional Development Seminar
Government and Public Affairs Teaching Training Seminar
Supervised Research
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: PUB_AF 8150, PhD standing or permission of instructor
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Research experience directed by major professor designed to prepare doctoral students for independent scholarship in area of doctoral specialization.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Empirical Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Instructors consent or PUB_AF 8181, PUB_AF 9180, and PUB_AF 9181
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as ECONOM 9446).  Empirical and modeling techniques for evaluation of microeconomic policy questions. Graded A-F only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Microeconomic Policy Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Instructor's consentRecommended: PUB_AF 8181, PUB_AF 9180 and PUB_AF 9181
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Applies the methods and techniques of microeconomics and to specific timely policy questions.  Taught by applied-microeconomics faculty and focuses on current topics in labor economics, public economics, crime economics, the economics of education, health economics, and other applied areas of microeconomics.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Careers in Public Health
Introduction to Public Health and Health Promotion
Health Issues in Aging
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Public Health Majors during early registration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course focuses on promotion and maintenance of the health and well-being of the older adult population. Current trends and needs of the ever changing and diversifying older adult population are discussed. The physiological and psychological domains, socio-cultural influences, legal and ethical issues, and health care resources pertaining to older adults in relationship to their health and quality of life are explored. Assessments, problems and strengths, interventions, and outcomes specific to the older adult population are discussed. Opportunities are provided for interaction with the older adult population through service learning. Graded on A-F basis only.
