https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: knowledge of Latin, to be demonstrated by passing departmental written examination or by completing LATIN 7110 with grade of B or better

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research and Practice in Applied Behavior Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will learn about the principles and procedures of applied behavior analysis through weekly reading assignments, discussions, and presentations. Student will gain experience applying this knowledge to improve behavior in a practical setting. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Assessment and Evaluation in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7320).  Procedures and instruments used in the assessment of individual with disabilities, including standardized and non-standardized measures of intellectual ability, academic achievement, oral language, social/emotional behaviors, career/vocational needs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language Development of Exceptional Students
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7325).  Study of language and communication issues and disorders in special education; normal and atypical language development; language assessment and intervention models and programs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Collaboration and Consultation in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4330).  Study of communication, problem-solving, collaboration strategies. Application of strategies to work with exceptional students, their families, other professional members of interdisciplinary, interagency teams.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Literacy in Special Education II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7371).  Advanced study in literacy methods and research for students with disabilities.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Methods in Cross-Categorical Special Education - Writing Intensive
Science and Social Studies for Struggling Learners
Diagnosis and Remediation of Learning Problems in Math - Middle
Capstone Seminar and Portfolio in Special Education
Assessment and Evaluation in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4320).  Procedures and instruments used in the assessment of individual with disabilities, including standardized and non-standardized measures of intellectual ability, academic achievement, oral language, social/emotional behaviors, career/vocational needs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language Development of Exceptional Students
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 7325).  Study of language and communication issues and disorders in special education; normal and atypical language development; language assessment and intervention models and programs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Collaboration and Consultation in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4330).  Study of communication, problem-solving, collaboration strategies. Application of strategies to work with exceptional students, their families, other professional members of interdisciplinary, interagency teams.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Literacy in Special Education II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4371).  Advanced study in literacy methods and research for students with disabilities.  Graded A-F only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Cross Categorical Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SPC_ED 4375).  Study of characteristics of students with cross categorical disabilities and other pertinent issues including inclusion, assessment, and evaluation practices.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Science and Social Studies for Struggling Learners
Diagnosis and  Remediation of Learning Problems in Math-Middle
Concepts and Principles in Behavior Analysis
Evaluation and Data-Based Decision Making in Special Education
Developmental Processes in Autism and Neurodevelopmental Disorders
Students with Behavioral Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Study of characteristics of students with behavioral disorders as they relate to best practices for assessment, instruction, and intervention.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Ethics in Applied Behavior Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Student must be enrolled in the Graduate Certificate in ABA or Master's in ABA program
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This graduate level course provides the student with an in-depth coverage of ethics and professional behavior in applied behavior analysis. This course will help the student become prepared to sit for the Behavior Analyst Certification Board exam. This course primarily emphasizes Content Area #1 (Ethical Considerations) but also Content Areas #4, 5, and 8 (Behavioral Assessment, Experimental Evaluation of Interventions, and Selecting Intervention Outcomes and Strategies) of the Behavior Analysis Task List - Fourth Edition. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Students With Learning Disabilities
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Study of characteristics of students with learning disabilities as they relate to best practices for assessment, instruction, and intervention.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language and Communication in Special Education
Advanced Teaching Mathematics in Special Education
Foundations of Science of Reading for Children with Disabilities
Applications of Science of Reading for Children with Disabilities
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The purpose of this course is to provide graduate students with advanced study in research and application of the science of reading. According to the International Literacy Association, the science of reading is "a corpus of objective investigation and accumulation of reliable evidence about how humans learn to read and how reading should be taught." The focus of the course will be on the corpus of evidence on how reading should be taught with students with, or who are at-risk for developing, disabilities including dyslexia.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Studies in Developmental Disabilities
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Current theories and practices and their historic roots through examination of empirical and descriptive literature.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research with Exceptional Children
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Explores significant, historical, and current research in special education. Emphasizes the application of research, methodology, and findings relative to problems facing the practitioner.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Studies: Single Subject Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The course is for advanced graduate students in special education, k psychology, related fields and includes behavioral measurement, single subject research designs, data analysis methods, critical analysis and evaluation of single subject research and research proposal. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Grant Writing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Preparation of research, demonstration, training, or other grant proposals meeting the criteria for competitive funding by a federal agency; review and evaluation of proposals.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Special Education Administration
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles, protective safeguards, and general practices associated with the organization and administration of special education; legal foundations for special education; selection, training, and supervision of personnel.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research Design in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: ESC_PS 4170 or equivalent, SPC_ED 8350 or equivalent, and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of professional writing and intermediate research applications with a focus on knowledge and skills needed for higher level doctoral work in statistics and research design.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Foundations I: History, Law and Policy in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The changing concept of disability will be viewed from the perspectives of history, legal issues, and policy traced from early Greek and European periods through contemporary times.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Foundations II: Pedagogical Theories in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A study of theories of teaching as they apply to special education with emphases on empirically based practices, historical trends, current theories, and the relationship between theories of learning and teaching.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Nature and Needs of Gifted and Talented Students
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A conceptual and empirical examination for educational personnel of student identification procedures, special populations, programming issues, research topics and teacher competencies.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Individualized Assessment and Intervention
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course builds upon the basic principles of learning and applied behavior analysis presented during previous courses in the Behavior Analysis core. The course will offer advanced coverage of the functional assessment of problem behaviors. In particular, there will be a strong emphasis in the functional analysis of problem behaviors. Additionally, this course will focus on how identification of function guides treatment development (i.e., function-based treatments). Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Curriculum Methods for Gifted and Talented Students
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A theoretical examination for educational personnel of specific instructional approaches including structure of intellect, enrichment triad, empirical research, and creative problem solving.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Assessment and Evaluation in Gifted Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Seminar focuses on practices for identifying students for gifted education programs, evaluation models applicable to school programs and strategies for grading and evaluation of gifted students.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Differentiating Instruction: Reaching Gifted, Typical and Struggling Learners
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Introduction to Special Education; instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Explores various instructional approaches to help meet the learning needs of a range of learners from gifted through struggling and at-risk students. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Administration and Supervision of Gifted Education Programs
Advanced Behavior Management: Applied Behavior Analysis
Verbal Behavior
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will provide an introduction to a behavior analytic approach to the study of language (i.e., verbal behavior). The course will have two related focuses: (a) the theoretical underpinnings of a functional approach to language and (b) a review of the testing and application of the theory of verbal behavior in research and practice. During the first half of the semester, we will read and discuss Skinner's analysis of verbal behavior (VB). During the second half of the semester we will survey the literature base supporting a behavior analytic approach to language and will also discuss the application of verbal behavior analysis to practice. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Studies in Behavioral Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Contemporary issues a historical perspective; theoretical perspectives or models which guide research, policy, and intervention approaches.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Survey of Applied Behavior Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course builds upon the basic principles of learning and applied behavior analysis presented during previous courses in the Behavior Analysis core. The course will offer coverage of the many different applications of behavior analysis (e.g., behavioral medicine, behavioral gerontology, substance abuse, organizational behavior management, etc.). Finally, this class will cover topics related to professional development. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Advanced Studies in Learning Disabilities
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: admission to graduate study and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Major current issues, trends, and controversies in learning disabilities; theories, research, and practices in learning disabilities.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction and Methods of Early Intervention
Assessment in Early Childhood Special Education
Introduction and Methods of Early Childhood Special Education
Systems Level Behavior Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course will offer an introduction to the application of behavior analytic concepts and principles to problems of human behavior at the systems level. Students will learn the basics of modifying behavior at the systems level, which includes clinical settings. Class assignments will help the students learn to apply the concepts discussed in class to their own work environment. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Meeting the Needs of all Learners
Introduction to Autism
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Introduction to Special Education; instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course provides an introduction of children youth with autism spectrum disorders. Topics include: historical and theoretical foundations, diagnostic and assessment approaches, and characteristics. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Methods of Instruction for Students with Autism
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of interventions for individuals with autism spectrum disorders and strategies needed for teaching. Best practices and promising practices will be presented. Course graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Social Competency for Students with Autism
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Course provides a framework for addressing social competence deficits experienced by students with autism. Course graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: High Functioning Students with Autism
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: The course is designed to increase understanding and ability to support individuals on the Autism Spectrum who have average to above average intelligence. Course graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Young Children with Autism
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Current research on characteristics, diagnosis, and intervention for very young children with autism. Strategies for support children and their families. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Assessment in Autism, Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course covers procedures and instruments used in assessment of school-aged children with autism, including screening, diagnosis, interpretation of assessment findings, and application to instructional plans. Graded on A-F only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Evidence Based Methods and Critical Inquiry in Cross Categorical Disabilities
Practicum: Students with Behavioral Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Graduate field experience in educational setting for students with behavioral disorders. Application of competencies from SPC_ED 8300.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Practicum: Gifted Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Provides graduate field experience in the area of gifted education.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Internship: College Teaching in Special Education
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Individually guided and supervised college teaching experiences. Competency based activities using portfolio assessment methods. May be taken more than once. Graded on S/U basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Internship: Professional Practice in Special Education
Level I Guided Reading and Vocabulary
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: must be admitted to the IEP program and placed into the course by the IEP; consent of department required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will increase reading fluency and vocabulary in beginning-level texts while developing independence and an appreciation of reading.  Not open to native speakers of English. No college credit.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Communication Science and Disorders
American Sign Language II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course is designed to increase students' understanding of American Sign Language. Students will increase their sign vocabulary, expressive and receptive skills, an understanding of ASL syntax and grammar.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: American Sign Language III
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: SLHS 1200 with minimum grade of C or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course expands on vocabulary and signing skills developed in ASL II. Includes review of ASL grammar and extensive discussions of ASL linguistic structure and Deaf culture. Class is conducted entirely in ASL. Course graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: American Phonetics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as LINGST 3010). Analysis of production and acoustics of the sounds of speech with an emphasis on American English; practice in broad and narrow transcription using the International Phonetic Alphabet.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Normal Language Development
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Language development in children and changes in language processing during normal aging. Cognition and language; language learning processes; language sample analysis; relationship between spoken and written language.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Normal Language Development - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Language development in children and changes in language processing during normal aging. Cognition and language; language learning processes; language sample analysis; relationship between spoken and written language.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Anatomy and Physiology of the Speech Mechanism
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as LINGST 3210). Introduction to anatomical and functional aspects of the speech mechanism.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Speech Acoustics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as LINGST 3220).  An introduction to the acoustic aspects of speech as they relate to the respiratory, phonatory, resonatory, and articulatory systems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Hearing Science
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to the nature of sound and its measurement; anatomy and physiology of the auditory and vestibular systems; psychoacoustic methods and phenomena.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research Methods in Speech and Language Sciences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course is designed to help students gain an understanding of how research in the discipline of speech and language sciences is conducted and how to differentiate between good-quality and poor-quality research design. We will explore the importance of the scientific method in conducting rigorous research. The course will enable students to explore the different types of research conducted within the discipline and will prepare students for an introductory experience in a research lab. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Language Disorders in Children
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of language disorders from early childhood through adolescence. Includes language disorders as primary disability and as secondary to other disabilities. Introduction to assessment and intervention.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language Disorders in Children - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorder majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of language disorders from early childhood through adolescence. Includes language disorders as primary disability and as secondary to other disabilities. Introduction to assessment and intervention.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language Disorders of Adults
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to acquired adult language disorders.  Review of neuroanatomy/physiology, etiology and symptomatology, with introduction to assessment and treatment procedures.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Fluency Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Introduction to the nature, assessment, and treatment of fluency disorders.  Emphasis on developmental stuttering.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Disorders of Phonology and Articulation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Overview of disorders of use and production of speech sounds with an emphasis on developmental disorders. Introduction to assessment and treatment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Audiology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: SLHS 3230; Communication Science and Disorders majors only or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles and techniques of audiological testing; etiologies of hearing impairment; current technologies in rehabilitation.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aural Rehabilitation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 7340). Identification, evaluation, and management of problems associated with hearing impairment in both children and adults. Includes issues related to speech/language development, communication, education, and social factors.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Aural Rehabilitation-Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 7340). Identification, evaluation, and management of problems associated with hearing impairment in both children and adults. Includes issues related to speech/language development, communication, education, and social factors.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Reading and Language Disabilities in School Age Children
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 7420). The focus of this course is on prevention, identification, assessment, and intervention for language and reading disorders in school-age children. We will learn about evidence-based practice in language and reading disorders, as well as develop the explicit linguistic knowledge necessary to deliver effective intervention. We will emphasize the roles and responsibilities of speech-language pathologists in direct service delivery and as members of the educational team. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Neurophysiology for Speech, Language, and Hearing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communications Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 7430). Principles of basic neurophysiology, emphasizing correlation of structure and function of the nervous system.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Multicultural Considerations in Speech, Language and Hearing Sciences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: senior standing, restricted to BHS students in SLHS major
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course is designed to heighten student awareness and sensitivity to the cultural and linguistic differences that affect the identification, assessment, treatment, and provision of services to individuals with communication disorders or differences. Throughout this course, topics related to diverse cultures and practices will be explored, and opportunities to apply knowledge of cultural considerations to assessment and treatment practices within speech, language and hearing sciences will be provided. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Individual Differences in Language Processing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 7830). Examination of the normal variations exhibited across individuals in the acquisition, use, and representation of language.  Also considered are individual differences seen in second language learning, the aging process, and language disorders.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Language and Development in Infancy
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: senior standing required. Instructor's consent required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as PSYCH 4442; cross-leveled with SLHS 7840, PSYCH 7442). Overview of theory and research on the foundations and development of language in infancy (0 to 2 years), with an emphasis on relevant, interrelated areas of development, individual differences, early recognition of delay, and assessment.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Observation in Communication Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders  majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Directed clinical observations designed to prepare the student for clinical practicum. Required for professional certification. Graded on a S/U basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Directed Reading in Communication Science and Disorders
Honors Thesis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Senior standing; 3.3 GPA; 3.5 GPA in Communication Science and Disorders courses; instructor's consent. Restricted to Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Individual honors thesis on a topic selected with a faculty advisor. Requires planning, conducting, and writing up a research project under the guidance of a faculty member. Successful completion of thesis and maintenance of 3.3 GPA, leads to degree with departmental honors. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Problems in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Aural Rehabilitation
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 4340). Identification, evaluation, and management of problems associated with hearing impairment in both children and adults. Includes issues related to speech/language development, communication, education, and social factors.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Reading and Language Disabilities in School Age Children
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 4420).  This course will focus on three key questions: (1) The science of reading: How do children learn to read? (2) Effective instruction: What kind of teaching helps children learn to read? (3) Intensive intervention: What do struggling readers need to succeed? We will learn about evidence-based practice in reading and language disorders, as well as develop the explicit linguistic knowledge necessary to deliver effective intervention. We will consider the roles and responsibilities of speech-language pathologists in prevention and intervention of reading disorders. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Neurophysiology for Speech, Language, and Hearing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders majors or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with SLHS 4430). Principles of basic neurophysiology, emphasizing correlation of structure and function of the nervous system.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Topics in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Developmental Language Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Nature, etiology, assessment and management of childhood language disorders.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Acquired Language Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Etiology, symptomatology, assessment and rehabilitation of acquired neurogenic communication disorders in aphasia, traumatic brain injury, and dementia.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Research in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Problems in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Research in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Motor Speech Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Etiology, symptomatology, epidemiology, and prognosis of motor speech disorders resulting from acquired neurological damage.  Emphasis on clinical assessment and rehabilitation procedures. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Disorders of Fluency
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Identification and remediation of fluency disorders in children and adults.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Voice Science and Voice Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: restricted to MHS CSD students; or with instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Diagnosis and management of communicative disorders resulting from pathologies or misuse of the phonatory system. Includes experience with pertinent laboratory instrumentation. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Dysphagia
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Etiology, symptomatology, and epidemiology of acquired and developmental swallowing disorders (dysphagia).  Emphasis on instrumental and non-instrumental methods for assessing and treating dysphagia.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Methods in Speech-Language Pathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: An introduction to clinical procedures and evidence-based intervention methods relating to speech and language disorders.  Topics include session design, data collection, measurement of progress, reporting of clinical results, and various treatment options.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Diagnosis in Speech-Language Pathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: General principles of diagnosis; specific diagnostic tools and procedures for various speech and language disorders.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Neurological Bases of Speech and Language
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Structure and function of the human brain and nervous system including general organization, cranial nerves, basal ganglia, cerebellum, and descending motor pathways as related to the field of speech language pathology.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Speech Sound Disorders
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Principles of clinical assessment and treatment for speech sound disorders in children.  Includes foundations in research on early speech sound acquisition, organic and developmental disorders, and treatment efficacy.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Medical Speech-Language Pathology
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Restricted to MHS in SLHS students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course covers topics related to medical speech-language pathology practice, including anatomy and physiology, diagnoses, collaborations, and diagnostic and therapeutic approaches. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Augmentative and Alternative Communication
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Students will learn the principles of AAC assessment, methods of intervention, and types of technology available for individuals unable to communicate fully through speech. Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Issues in Professional Practice
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Organizational, inter-professional, economic, legal, and ethical aspects of delivering speech, language, and hearing services. Graded on A/F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Clinical Language Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Communication Science and Disorders students only
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course provides a theoretical framework for understanding the morphology, semantics, syntax, and pragmatics of English as well as practice in the analysis of typical and atypical language samples.  Graded on A-F basis only.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Directed Reading in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Research in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Research in Speech, Language and Hearing Science
Introductory Statistical Reasoning
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or higher in MATH _0110 or MyMathTest Intermediate Algebra score of 70% or higher
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Statistical concepts for critically evaluation quantitative information.  Descriptive statistics, probability, estimation, hypothesis testing, correlation and regression.  Students may not receive credit if they have received or are concurrently receiving credit for a higher numbered course offered by the Statistics Department.  Math Reasoning Proficiency Course.  Mathematical Sciences distribution course (requirement terms prior to fall 2019).

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Elementary Statistics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade in C - or higher in MATH 1100 or  MATH 1120 or MATH 1160 or MATH 1180 or exemption from college algebra by examination
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Collection, presentation of data; averages; dispersion; introduction to statistical inference, correlation and regression. Students may not receive credit if they have received or are concurrently receiving credit for another course offered by the Statistics Department. Math Reasoning Proficiency Course.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Elementary Statistics - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade of C-or higher in MATH 1100 or MATH 1120 or MATH 1160 or MATH 1180 or exemption from college algebra by examination. Honors eligibility required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Collection, presentation of data; averages; dispersion; introduction to statistical inference, correlation and regression. Students may not receive credit if they have received or are concurrently receiving credit for another course offered by the Statistics Department.  Math Reasoning Proficiency course.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Elementary Statistics for Life Sciences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade in C- or higher in MATH 1050 or MATH 1100 or MATH 1120 or MATH 1160 or MATH 1180 or exemption from college algebra by examination
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Designed for students studying agriculture and other life sciences. Descriptive statistics, probability, estimation, hypothesis testing, correlation and regression.  Students may not receive credit if they have received or are concurrently receiving credit for another course offered by the Statistics Department. Math Reasoning Proficiency Course.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MATH 1100 or MATH 1160Recommended: MATH 1300.  Students who will take MATH 1300 would be best-served to take it prior to enrollment in STAT 2500
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Designed primarily for students in College of Business. Descriptive statistics, probability, random variables, sampling distributions, estimation, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics I - Honors
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: C- or better in MATH 1100 or  MATH 1160.  Honors eligibility required
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Designed primarily for students in College of Business. Descriptive statistics, probability, random variables, sampling distributions, estimation, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Statistical Methods in Natural Resources
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: a college-level computing course and a grade in the C range or better in MATH 1100, MATH 1120, MATH 1160, or MATH 1180
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Statistical methods, with emphasis on applications to natural resources and including computer exercises. Math Reasoning Proficiency Course.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Intuition, Simulation, and Data
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Any one of DATA_SCI 1030 or STAT 1200 or STAT 2500 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: This course develops the probabilistic foundations of inference in data science and builds a comprehensive view of modeling and decision-making. Emphasis is on the nature of randomness, the power and limitations of inference, and the consequences of decision making. Students will experience probability, statistical inference, and the modeling of processes through the lens of simulation using the statistical programming language R.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Probability and Statistics II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: grade in the C - or higher in  STAT 2200 or STAT 2500 or STAT 2530, or  STAT 4710  or concurrent enrollment in STAT 2200
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Continuation of STAT 2500. Coverage of additional topics including: Regression; model building; ANOVA; nonparametic methods; use of a statistical computer package.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Connecting Statistics to Middle and Secondary Schools
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 1200 or STAT 1300 or STAT 1400 or STAT 2500 or STAT 4710 or ESC_PS 4170 or MATH 2320
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7050).  Primarily for middle and secondary mathematics education majors.  Uses standards-based curricular materials to demonstrate connections between college-level statistics and content taught in middle and secondary schools.  No credit toward a graduate degree in statistics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Statistical Software and Data Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 7070 or STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7110).  Programming with major statistical packages emphasizing data management techniques and statistical analysis for regression, analysis of variance, categorical data, descriptive statistics, non-parametric analyses, and other selected topics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Categorical Data Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 7070 or STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7150).  The study of statistical models and methods used in analyzing categorical data.  The use of computing is emphasized and calculus is not required.  No credit for students who have previously completed STAT 4830.  No credit toward a graduate degree in statistics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Nonparametric Methods
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 7070 or STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7210).  Statistical methods when the functional form of the population is unknown. Applications emphasized. Comparisons with parametric procedures. Goodness of-fit, chi-square, comparison of several populations, measures of correlation.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Sampling Techniques
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 7070 or STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Theory of probability sampling designs. Unrestricted random sampling. Stratified sampling. Cluster sampling. Multistage or subsampling. Ratio estimates. Regression estimates. Double sampling.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Methods in Sports Analytics I
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Any one of STAT 3500, STAT 7020, STAT 7070, STAT 4710/7710, STAT 4760/7760, or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7330). Introductory course on collecting, processing, visualizing, and analyzing data in sports. Technologies used in data collection and processing will be explored, along with methods for measuring and comparing individual and team performance.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Methods in Sports Analytics II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7340). Advanced course in methods for analyzing individual and team based performance in sports and the use of data to drive strategy and tactics. Emphasis will be put on analytical methods to improve skills and optimize the performance of athletes.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Survival Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 7070 or STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7420). Parametric models; Kaplan-Meier estimator; nonparametric estimation of survival and cumulative hazard functions; log-rank test; Cox model; Stratified Cox model; additive hazards model partial likelihood; regression diagnostics; multivariate survival data.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Statistical Models II
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7520). Advanced course in applied statistical modeling focusing on extensions of the linear model. Topics include generalized linear models, such as logistic and Poisson regression. Random effects models will also be introduced, with emphasis on linear and generalized linear mixed models, repeated measures, and longitudinal data. These methods will extend to general models for dependent data, such as spatially-referenced data and time series. Lastly, nonlinear models through neural networks and deep learning will also be discussed.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Experimental Design
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 4510 or STAT 7510 or STAT 4530 or STAT 7530
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7540). Examination and analysis of modern statistical techniques applicable to experimentation in social, physical or biological sciences.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Multivariate Data Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500, STAT 7070 STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760 or instructor's consent. No credit towards a graduate degree in statistics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7560). Testing mean vectors; Discriminant analysis; Principal components; Factor analysis; Cluster analysis; Structural equation modeling; Graphics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Statistical Methods for Customized Pricing
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 4510 or STAT 7510 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7580). Introduction to basic concepts of and statistical methods used in customized pricing.  Focuses on applying statistical methods to real customized pricing problems.  Students will gain an understanding of customized pricing and some hands on experience with SAS Enterprise Miner.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Applied Spatial Statistics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 4510 or instructor's consentRecommended: basic knowledge of calculus and matrices
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7610).  Introduction to spatial random processes, spatial point patterns, kriging, simultaneous and conditional autoregression, and spatial data analysis.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Bayesian Data Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7640). Bayes formulas, choices of prior, empirical Bayesian methods, hierarchal Bayesian methods, statistical computation, Bayesian estimation, model selection, predictive analysis, applications, Bayesian software.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Mathematical Statistics
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MATH 4315; cross-leveled with STAT 7710, MATH 7315). Introduction to theory of probability and statistics using concepts and methods of calculus.  No credit for MATH 4315.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Probability Theory
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MATH 4320; cross-leveled with STAT 7750, MATH 7320). Probability spaces; random variables and their distributions; repeated trials; probability limit theorems.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Statistical Inference
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (same as MATH 4520; cross-leveled with STAT 7760, MATH 7520). Sampling; point estimation; sampling distribution; tests of hypotheses; regression and linear hypotheses.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Categorical Data Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7830).  Discrete distributions, frequency data, multinomial data, chi-square and likelihood ratio tests, logistic regression, log linear models, rates, relative risks, random effects, case studies.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Introduction to Stochastic Processes
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7850). Study of random processes selected from: Markov chains, birth and death processes, random walks, Poisson processes, renewal theory, Brownian motion, Gaussian processes, white noise, spectral analysis, applications such as queuing theory, sequential tests.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Time Series Analysis
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 4710 or STAT 7710 or STAT 4760 or STAT 7760
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 7870).  A study of univariate and multivariate time series models and techniques for their analyses. Emphasis is on methodology rather than theory. Examples are drawn from a variety of areas including business, economics and soil science.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Junior/Senior Seminar
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Statistics major with Junior or Senior class standing  or instructor's consentRecommended: 12 completed hours of statistics courses with grade of C or better; STAT 4110
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A capstone course required of and open only to junior or senior statistics majors. Students will participate in statistical consulting, attend colloquia, and review articles in professional journals. Writing of reports will be emphasized.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Junior/Senior Seminar - Writing Intensive
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: Statistics major with Junior or Senior class standing  or instructor's consentRecommended: 12 completed hours of statistics courses with grade of C or better; STAT 4110
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: A capstone course required of and open only to junior or senior statistics majors. Students will participate in statistical consulting, attend colloquia, and review articles in professional journals. Writing of reports will be emphasized.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Statistical Methods in the Health Sciences
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: MATH 1100 or MATH 1120 and instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Basic inference methods, both parametric and non-parametric, appropriate for answering questions arising in health sciences research. Computer exercises involving data from real experiments from health science area.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Connecting Statistics to Middle and Secondary Schools
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: an introductory course in statistics or MATH 2320 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 4050).  Primarily for middle and secondary mathematics education majors.  Uses standards-based curricular materials to demonstrate connections between college-level statistics and content taught in middle and secondary schools.  No credit toward a graduate degree in statistics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Statistical Methods for Research
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Designed for graduate students who have no previous training in statistics. Topics include descriptive statistics, probability distributions, estimation, hypothesis testing, regression, and ANOVA. No credit toward a degree in statistics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 4110).  Programming with major statistical packages emphasizing data management techniques and statistical analysis for regression, analysis of variance, categorical data, descriptive statistics, non-parametric analyses, and other selected topics.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.title: Analysis of Variance
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500, STAT 7070, STAT 4710 or STAT 7710, STAT 4760 or STAT 7760, or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: Study of analysis of variance and related modeling techniques for cases with fixed, random, and mixed effects. Exposure to designs other than completely randomized designs including factorial arrangements, repeated measures, nested, and unequal sample size designs.

https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.prerequisites: STAT 3500 or STAT 4510 or STAT 7510 or STAT 4530 or STAT 7530 or instructor's consent
https://catalog.missouri.edu/courseoffer.description: (cross-leveled with STAT 4540).  Examination and analysis of modern statistical techniques applicable to experimentation in social, physical or biological sciences.
